story:
Our Gay History in 50 States is an educational book / audio book that tells the story of queer American history, state by state. The stories that make up this book celebrate significant people, places and events and highlight struggles, successes, and contributions of the LGBTQIA+ community, creating a history to be passed on to future generations.

(This is a mockup of the book cover)

The state by state format illustrates that LGBT history happens in every state, everywhere LGBT people live, and that gay history is American history. We see this book as an opportunity to increase acceptance of the queer community, to highlight the diversity within the community itself, and to educate American society as a whole.

The target audience of Our Gay History in 50 States are readers ages 15 and above. However, the content of the book can easily be amended by the reader for appropriateness for younger audiences. 

This book fills the increasing need for positive information and storytelling of American queer history. Our Gay History in 50 States will be a single point reference guide, in print and online, for this purpose.

The historical storyline will cover issues such as the evolution of Gay Pride and marriage equality, along with topics such as freedom, oppression, celebration, sadness, responsibility, hiding, protesting, love and happiness, and most of all, being true to one’s self no matter the cost. 

(Sample Alabama State Entry Page 50-51)

Our goal is to make this book accessible in public schools, libraries, and other learning centers across the county.

(Sample Alabama State Entry Page 52-53)

All of this content and more will be available to our audiences at a reasonable cost and for purchase at retail outlets and online. The book’s content has been prepared through extensive research by queer youth from across the country who were paid a living wage for their efforts.

On top of that, a percentage of profits from book sales will go to LGBTQIA+ oriented non-profits such as The Matthew Shepard Foundation, RECLAIM!, the Trevor Project, Mossier Social Action and Innovation Center, and Gay & Lesbian Centers across the country. We envision that Our Gay History in 50 States will create a stronger future generation - one that is more equitable, respectful, and visibly engaged in challenging systemic oppression. Learn more about this at our website, www.gay50states.com . Thank you for your interest in promoting our gay history and thank you for supporting this project!

The Title

We understand that the title may suggest a more limited scope than the book actually covers. This book is not only about gay and lesbian people, but everyone within the LGBTQIA+ community. We’ve chosen the title because the history we are highlighting started with the “gay rights movement.” There was a time that this umbrella term provided aid and comfort to anyone who was not accepted by the dominant culture. Without those early pioneers, we likely wouldn’t be fighting (collectively) for the full inclusion of bisexual, transgender, queer, questioning, intersex, pansexual, asexual, and allied persons. The title is not meant to exclude any in our community, and we hope this explanation provides some clarity regarding why it was selected.

The Term “queer”

Queer is a controversial term that means different things to different people. For older generations, queer was a derogatory term used to hurt anyone who didn’t “fit in.” Younger generations have reclaimed the term “queer” as a self-affirming umbrella term. We encourage reclaiming ourselves and our lives on our own terms. So this book will use the term queer in this positive fashion (thanks millennials!).

Birth State

People always wonder how were able to secure information on so many queer people in so many conservative states. This was a threshold challenge that we addressed from the very beginning. LGBTQIA+ people are born in every part of our great country and were it not for societal pressures, discrimination, and violence, they may have chosen to stay in their hometowns. We wanted to honor this fact, so each honoree’s contributions are being credited to their home state (their state of birth).

 

Endorsements: 

"With Our Gay History in 50 States, Zaylore Sapphos Stout has created something entirely new—a comprehensive, state-by-state chronicle of LGBTQ history for youth. This type of content is sorely needed in schools. Learning about significant individuals and contributions within the queer community validates those with LGBTQ identities at the same time it provides a wider lens of the experiences of others, building the foundational knowledge essential to empathy and ally behavior. Stout’s book is an important reminder to all students—of all identities—that all stories matter." – Cheryl Greene - Deputy Director, Welcoming Schools – Human Rights Campaign

“This informative collection of stories and facts helps bring to life the experience of LGBT people in all parts of our country. It shows that everyday people from all walks of life can become heroes and make significant contributions to our community. These stories can inspire anyone looking to make a difference in their own corner of the world.” —Andrew Park, Former Director of International Programs at the Williams Institute, UCLA School of Law, and founder of the Center for Lesbian and Gay Civil Rights in Philadelphia

"Our Gay History in 50 States is a fantastic road trip! From surprises to familiar faces/spaces, Zaylore Stout's book is important knowledge for the twenty-first century. LGBTQIA+ history is everyone's history." -Kirstin Cronn-Mills, author of Beautiful Music for Ugly Children and LGBTQ+ Athletes Claim the Field: Striving for Equality.

"Colorful, dynamic, and engaging, Our Gay History in 50 States is packed full with fascinating anecdotes and inspiring history. This book makes me want to take a road-trip to visit every place it mentions! A celebration of the diversity and complexity of the many American LGBTQ communities and individuals that have enriched this country's history, Our Gay History in 50 States is a powerful and essential new resource."— Noam Sienna, A Rainbow Thread: An Anthology of Queer Jewish Texts from the First Century to 1969.

"This isn't really a history book or a reference book--it's a celebration of our people's lives, passions, accomplishments, and contributions. Finding your state and poring over its entries will feel like paging through a big gay yearbook, lovingly compiled just for you. These amazing people and places and events are reaching across time to connect with you, and to show you that you're not alone. OUR GAY HISTORY IN 50 STATES will help today's LGBTQIA+ youth feel a real sense of belonging in the state and country that is their home."-Molly Beth Griffin, author of the queer YA novel Silhouette of a Sparrow, and contributor to the new anthology Queer Voices: Poetry, Prose, and Pride.

"Throughout history, the LGBTQ people, voices, and contributions have been summarily ignored, silenced, and erased. Zaylore Stout gives voice to so many stories. This state-by-state guide to history offers young people an impressive list of role models, heroes, and moments to look up to and emulate. As a college professor, I can't wait to share these with my students to offer a more diverse and inclusive history." - Amy Zsohar, PhD, Communications Professor.

story:
The newly created BOOK SELFIE is an alternate online channel for self-publishing authors to sell their books and expand their reach to many more readers, where booklovers can buy and read books without the interference of a forceful algorithm.

 

Easily upload your eBooks and print books, and upload your icon and header to create your online e-Bookstore.

 

We all know the cost of the book is lower in bulk, and we have developed our site accordingly. You can sell your print books that you have in your stock, and send them directly to the booklovers.

 

You want to put your best foot forward? Yes you can, on Book Selfie. Upload your 3D book covers as your showcase to have a better looking bookstore.

 

Not only 3D book covers, you can also upload extra images to prim up your books to enhance your sales.

 

They are your books and you are in control of the pricing. We don’t tell you the minimum price. You do your own calculations and price them out at your will. No problem!

 

Do you want to be in the middle of the herd, where the big company has special deals with the large publishers, or even a publisher itself?

This is one of the main breaks that we are offering to the indie-author... to be really “indie”. 

 

There are no ads to push any books to the top, reviews don’t push books to the top, there are no biases, and there are no influencers.

It is an equal opportunity environment, where everybody is on the same playing field.

 

Really simple. Since our platform is subscription based, it is really simple to sell your eBooks. Someone downloads your eBook you get paid a certain amount. There are no complicated calculations of %35, %70, etc...

 

Book Selfie is a subscription based platform, where you can read unlimited  eBooks on our free app with a valid subscription.

 

Download your eBooks, the rest is not a problem. On the plane, on the metro rail… you still have access to your eBooks anywhere even if there is no internet connection.

 

Directly supporting the creators of the books is important for us. When you purchase a print book, you purchase it directly from the indie-author.

 

Not only you have access to eBooks, you can also use our app to purchase print books anywhere, anytime.

 

You don’t even have to buy expensive devices to be able to highlight and bookmark your eBook. Just bookmark any page or highlight anything with different colors and go back later. Never miss a page, important paragraph, or even a word.

 

Purchase print books and eBook subscriptions from Book Selfie with a clear conscious that your money is not going to the big company to have a stronger grip on the book market to have a deeper control.

 

We do not track your buying habits, we do not keep records of your search habits. We respect your privacy!

 

No tagging, no cross selling, no upselling, no down selling… just print books and eBooks… just indie-authors and booklovers. That’s all!

 

No, we don’t assess your buying habits, or keep track of your purchases to push books on you. You will see exactly what you are looking for.

 

Everybody enjoys high quality books. It is our mission to create a mutually exclusive environment, where indie-authors get what they highly deserve in fairness to gratify the booklovers with what they deserve.

In order to accomplish our task, and our mission, we have spent innumerable hours making plans and sweating the details… and now we need your support to take it further!

 

We are asking for $50,000.00 for the following planned tasks:

  • Increase our presence to reach more indie-authors
  • Implement audiobook functionality to our app
  • Improve and upgrade our platform
  • Redesign and improve our app
  • Create a support team for indie-authors

 

We are a team of husband and wife, who have been in the publishing industry for more than ten years, as we use our finance and technical engineering background to reinforce our presence.

We have spent the past five years establishing two platforms for indie-authors.

One in Turkey, which brought the concept of “indie-author” along with the POD to the country, providing an option to the authors to be free from a handful large publishers (similar to the United States.)

...and another one in the United States with the same mission to free indie-authors from being captives of one (particular) company.

Our goal - our vision is to become a disruptive force in the publishing industry to bring fairness and tangible solutions to the authors.

 

We believe indie-authors are the driving force, and booklovers are the beneficiaries from their creations. We, in Book Selfie, are simply the medium to bring them together on our platform. On that note, “being relentless” would be the basis of our mission as to make progress and bring fairness to the publishing industry by putting these two worlds together.

Meryem & Gurhan Demirkan
story_txt:
The newly created BOOK SELFIE is an alternate online channel for self-publishing authors to sell their books and expand their reach to many more readers, where booklovers can buy and read books without the interference of a forceful algorithm.

 



Easily upload your eBooks and print books, and upload your icon and header to create your online e-Bookstore.
 

We all know the cost of the book is lower in bulk, and we have developed our site accordingly. You can sell your print books that you have in your stock, and send them directly to the booklovers.

 

You want to put your best foot forward? Yes you can, on Book Selfie. Upload your 3D book covers as your showcase to have a better looking bookstore.

 

Not only 3D book covers, you can also upload extra images to prim up your books to enhance your sales.


 


They are your books and you are in control of the pricing. We don’t tell you the minimum price. You do your own calculations and price them out at your will. No problem! 
Do you want to be in the middle of the herd, where the big company has special deals with the large publishers, or even a publisher itself?
This is one of the main breaks that we are offering to the indie-author... to be really “indie”.  
There are no ads to push any books to the top, reviews don’t push books to the top, there are no biases, and there are no influencers.
It is an equal opportunity environment, where everybody is on the same playing field.


 

Really simple. Since our platform is subscription based, it is really simple to sell your eBooks. Someone downloads your eBook you get paid a certain amount. There are no complicated calculations of %35, %70, etc...

 



Book Selfie is a subscription based platform, where you can read unlimited  eBooks on our free app with a valid subscription.

 

Download your eBooks, the rest is not a problem. On the plane, on the metro rail… you still have access to your eBooks anywhere even if there is no internet connection.

 

Directly supporting the creators of the books is important for us. When you purchase a print book, you purchase it directly from the indie-author.

 

Not only you have access to eBooks, you can also use our app to purchase print books anywhere, anytime.

 

You don’t even have to buy expensive devices to be able to highlight and bookmark your eBook. Just bookmark any page or highlight anything with different colors and go back later. Never miss a page, important paragraph, or even a word.

 

Purchase print books and eBook subscriptions from Book Selfie with a clear conscious that your money is not going to the big company to have a stronger grip on the book market to have a deeper control.
 

We do not track your buying habits, we do not keep records of your search habits. We respect your privacy!
 

No tagging, no cross selling, no upselling, no down selling… just print books and eBooks… just indie-authors and booklovers. That’s all!
 

No, we don’t assess your buying habits, or keep track of your purchases to push books on you. You will see exactly what you are looking for.
 

Everybody enjoys high quality books. It is our mission to create a mutually exclusive environment, where indie-authors get what they highly deserve in fairness to gratify the booklovers with what they deserve.
In order to accomplish our task, and our mission, we have spent innumerable hours making plans and sweating the details… and now we need your support to take it further!
 
We are asking for $50,000.00 for the following planned tasks:

Increase our presence to reach more indie-authors
Implement audiobook functionality to our app
Improve and upgrade our platform
Redesign and improve our app
Create a support team for indie-authors

 


We are a team of husband and wife, who have been in the publishing industry for more than ten years, as we use our finance and technical engineering background to reinforce our presence.
We have spent the past five years establishing two platforms for indie-authors.
One in Turkey, which brought the concept of “indie-author” along with the POD to the country, providing an option to the authors to be free from a handful large publishers (similar to the United States.)
...and another one in the United States with the same mission to free indie-authors from being captives of one (particular) company.
Our goal - our vision is to become a disruptive force in the publishing industry to bring fairness and tangible solutions to the authors.
 

We believe indie-authors are the driving force, and booklovers are the beneficiaries from their creations. We, in Book Selfie, are simply the medium to bring them together on our platform. On that note, “being relentless” would be the basis of our mission as to make progress and bring fairness to the publishing industry by putting these two worlds together.
Meryem & Gurhan Demirkan

story:
Launch Two Books That Helps People Make Better Marketing Decisions And Help Them Communicate Online Better 

I am launching two nonfiction books, one that is aimed at small & medium size businesses that want to improve their sales and customer experience with digital marketing analytic, and a second that gets to the heart of why people are having bad communication online and off - from trolling to debates related to the 2016 election, bad communication is everywhere.

Book One: Breakthrough Measures

This marketing analytics book takes a look at how analytics can be used within your business to connect to your customers, helping businesses understand how to leverage their social media, their paid search, and their other offline marketing which is impacted.  The book reflects over 8 years of experience and is preceded by articles written in CMSWire, All Analytics, and DMNews. 

  • Chapter 1 The Lay of the Land – This introduction covers the meaning behind current stats and trends, and looks at what technology and business resources should be in place. The reader will know how digital marketing should be set against business objectives 10 pg
  • Chapter 2 Organizing Where The Journey Begins This section will touch upon key pieces that should be in place.  This chapter will also include basic website code to help users know what can be done for simple tasks and for using a tag manager to organize tags. 20 pg
  • Chapter 3 Search Basics This chapter covers the latest resources and steps for developing a search strategy.  This chapter will cover developing a customer persona, inserted against site code, and how keywords are selected  20 pg
  • Chapter 4 Mobile Basics This chapter covers the latest resources and steps for developing a mobile strategy.  This chapter will cover how mobile SEO is managed and ideas for selecting a mobile landing page.  A segment on apps development and how it relates to analytics will be addressed 15 pg
  • Chapter 5  Ad Basics - Paid and Social This chapter covers the latest resources and steps for developing a paid search strategy.  This chapter will cover the latest information from paid search ads and social ads.  Google, Bing, Pinterest, Amazon, Facebook and Instagram will be covered. An explanation of varying the marketing message will be included.  20 pg
  • Chapter 6 Social Media Basics This chapter covers the latest social media resources, and is meant to explain how a small business should manage across the platforms.  This will touch upon social dashboards and be a bridge to analytics – strategies is to learn how to engage on a platform and measure a result. This chapter will focus on how to best manage content for varying platforms (content marketing, video/live recording).   25 pg
  • Chapter 7 Analytics Reporting: Where To Look First This chapter covers the basic metrics and how the reporting can work for guiding a business decision regarding search, paid search, and social media   50pg
  • Chapter 8 Analytics Reporting: Where To Look Next This chapter covers developing a segmentation that shows how customers are connecting to the site contents. Topics will include multichannel reporting, custom variables, custom reports, and filters   50 pg
  • Chapter 9 Analytics Reporting: Advanced Measures  This chapter covers the latest ideas and concepts for connecting metrics to business objectives, such as customer lifetime value. It will also cover some basic ideas for using advanced tools such as R programming and data mining based on GA. 40 pg
  • Chapter 10 Visualizing The Breakthroughs  This chapter covers simple dashboard concerns and keeping everyone on a small business team on-message with the results.  This will include data visualization tools and plugins for Excel dashboards   30 pg
  • Chapter 11 Repairman: Basic Analytic Diagnostics and Data Security This chapter covers simple diagnostic concerns that can arise with respect to analytics tags, page speed performance, and maintaining secure usage of data.  30 pg
  • Chapter 12 Upgrade Your Marketing This chapter covers the how a small business should look at updated its content. It will provide resources for maintaining current to date with the latest digital marketing and technology trends  10 pg

Book Two: It Got Back To The Wrong People

This book, which its genesis is an offshoot of Breakthrough Measures, examines how  digital technology & media combined with social behavior influences our collective means for expressing opinions and responding to comments.  The impacts are widespread, from marketers whose brands now encounter people's values in their efforts, to  the everyday person, culminating in the aftermath of the 2016 US election.   

People are interested in dialogue as long as it is meaningful.  The book can help foster that dialogue.

People features an overview of how media and shifting public usage of technology connects to  communication and social issues offline.  The first chapters explain the digital influences. The second set shows examples within the arts and politics, as well as various cultures.  The last chapters provide context, tips to discern issues, and recommendations on what to do. Anyone who reads it will learn, reflect, and enjoy the ideas to communicate effectively.  

  • Chapter 1  Big Mouth: A Brief History of How “It" Got Back To You Starting with an examination of a comment from Bill Cosby on his 2004 NAACP awards speech - nicknamed the "Pound Cake” speech - this chapter looks at some of the social issues and public events that have been impacted when exposed online.  The chapter offers thoughts of how our comments on issues are observational, but leave out an examination of causal effects - and how such instances impacts communication and context surround social media online.  This chapter will note well-known discussions in media, from entertainment, business, and government (which will also serve into the first few chapters as well).
  • Chapter 2  "The Media” Reflects On You This chapter notes the history of the new broadcasts from the pre-cable days to now, and how our collective understanding of information has changed.  People have the impression that the media is biased and unfair, but shifts in how information is presented means that it can be a mirror to ourselves rather than a collective, shared understanding. Media may be acting more as a mirror, just like the internet. This chapter ultimately will look at how our communication and everyday judgement have been impacted.   Example:  The media may be acting more as a mirror, similar to the internet  (Filter Bubble advocated by Eli Pariser,  Pop news coverage over the years (Michael Jackson, OJ Simpson trial) influencing coverage, consolidation of news media sources ); Fake news is forcing social media platforms to better police their content.
  • Chapter 3  Wade in the Social Media Water: Our Community Online  This chapter examines the rise of social media and how it - and the commercialism that embraced it first - has becomes influential in how we communicate.   The chapter name is a variation of the old Negro spiritual "Wade In The Water", meant in this instance as a metaphor for how people wade in the "waters of information” — at different banks, different time of day, and for different purposes.  Therefore our experiences become a number of opinions with varying degrees of communication skills that can hard to discern online.  Example Thought:   Everyone can offer their opinion on social media, but that opinion can spread. That can be dangerous for small businesses (Memories Pizza in Indiana, Amy Baking Company in Arizona) and individuals (#CecilTheLion)
  • Chapter 4  Everything Sticks: How Technology Can Change The Scope of Our Common Sense and Ethics The character Selina Kyle/Catwoman, as portrayed by Anne Hathaway in The Dark Knight Rises, once complained that starting fresh in life is hard because "everything sticks". This chapter will take a look at how various everyday tech - from our devices to analytics- can correlate information, but a key influencer, the data being examined, shifts separately of common sense and intuition. decisions.  For people and issues that are considered “data” in a debate, pitfalls appear when we have issues communicated through technology and media. Example Thought: People can be more analytical about their lives - their health, their choices in how they spend their money, map places they need to go. But the capability does not mean life is better for everyone.  The work behind a benefit has to be done to achieve a benefit from what is being measured.
  • Chapter 5  Asymmetric Truth: When Online Opinions Become Our Real Thoughts In Life Communication can create perceived correlations when there is more to it, but what we convey online does not always reveal offline influences. This chapter will cover how asymmetric information can develop, and how our opinions become facts when all the facts are not presented.  Twitter usage will be among the topics examined, as are examples of how social issues are rooted in asymmetric experiences for various people.  The chapter will also speak to how we process information in specific and diffuse ways, with a theme that we must seek information where possible. 

  • Chapter 6  Culture: How We Identify Ourselves   How we see ourselves influences how we communicate to the world. This chapter will examine how culture influence us as individuals, and how that shapes our discussions online. Notes about how personal experience, faith, psychology, and cultural issues such as women’s rights influence how we express our ideas online will be included.  Examples: Hashtag campaigns for women's issues in professional careers are examined — #ILookLikeAnEngineer,  #gamergate 

  • Chapter 7 Art: When We Dream of Life (and Life Becomes A Dream) The chapter examines instances in Art and Entertainment regarding how we express ourselves online. 
  • Chapter 8  Politics: The Art of Deciding Our Values, Our Fate, and Our Voice Examples in politics and activism regarding how we communicate online - why our debates need varied voices to make progress, and an examination of social bottlenecks to communication.
  • Chapter 9  Passing Knowledge: Organizing How You Listen, Explain, and Share Ideas Tips on how to assess the media you ingest online and how to review content for misleading or limited information.  Some tips will be based on analytic practices and will include social media platforms to help people select tools to appreciate the groups they choose to associate with online.
  • Chapter 10 In a Crowd Alone: Being Aware of How We Relate to People  Tips on how to to deal with people with our devices and behavior. We are always communicating, just like our devices - when do we to know when we are dealing with people in a straightforward manner.   
  • Chapter 11 What to Keep In Mind When Advocating  - Tips on what to look for when giving your message (and for marketers, small businesses, and nonprofits, how to look at context & metrics with a message).
  • Chapter 12  Never Throw Rocks And Hide Your Hands: How To Debate and Discuss Safely - Educate yourself on communicating safely online - what to look for from individuals online and off - the character and quality of posted material must align to be truthful.

Why these books are important

These books are important to me as way to engage people on seemingly different topics that are yet related ideas - much of analytics is related to context and communication online.  Breakthrough Measures will cover best practice in analysis, while  It Got Back To The Wrong People offers people a way to vet the ideas that they encounter online and choose to discuss.  

I wanted to introduce books that could benefits others through some best practices from my experiences and maybe shift debates so that people can have better conversations.   I've incorporated aspects of these experiences in my marketing presentations, but I  wanted a more dedicated platform to talk about best practices.

Details on what the funds will go towards

Ok folks, here's the details on how the funds will be used.

  • The books will be published via Bookbaby.
  • Perks are the books themselves, plus opportunities for workshops to be donated to a group of your choosing.  
  • Funds will cover book expenses (through Bookbaby - roughly $1200 to cover an initial run of 200 books), an editor to help review both books (est $1500/each), a designer who is starting work on the book covers ($400/each), two banners for conferences ($500/each), a dedicated website for the books (est $300), and marketing via paid search marketing via Linked In, Facebook, and Adwords.
  • The funds will also allow a dedicated budget for marketing the books consistently through 2017 and into 2018.  

There are Zimana funds earmarked for the project as well. Another Zimana product, an analytics app, is well underway. It will provide small businesses another way to manage expenses accurately, based on analytics.

Another issue, albeit personal, is the replacement of the "company car"  (The current car is a nearly 16 year old Ford Focus with over 233,000 miles as of this writing - vehicle was kept during graduate school, working, and while starting Zimana 8 years ago to keep start up costs low.  New speaking opportunities that require travel is now driving up wear and the need to replace it).

Thus any support for this project would be well appreciated, because additional resources can be used to help complete several tasks with more financial ease and ensuring better quality on the books!

Your Impact

Your contribution will make a difference in two major ways:

  • The world needs a communication book to help it understand how fake news and continual digital communication has altered trust among people, and to take action on making it better. It Got Back To The Wrong People will help folks. 
  • Small and medium size businesses need an up-to-date marketing analytics book, and it has been awhile since such a book has been on the market.  Breakthrough Measures will deliver a solid book that will help businesses compete cost-effectively to develop digital budgets.  As options become more complex, a simple guide is needed. Breakthrough Measures is that guide.

I have a really great business background  - I included video so you can see and hear me, as well as to get to know me professionally.  I am also uploading a few images that reflect the past work I have accomplished, so you know that this project's milestones will be delivered.  

 

Risks & Challenges

Right now the only key risk is managing time well through this year. 3 workshops are already scheduled, so I have to prepare those.  I am also working with a few clients and conducting developer work on an app that will create complementary services.  But the book project will be a success for several reasons:

  • I have worked under pressure before, so dedicate focus is at the core of this project from the start.  I am adding communication tools (Slack, Evernote) to be efficient. Evernote is used to speed up the time it takes to do the dictation and refine the text.  Slack will be used with the designer to manage the book.
  • I have experience not only writing but in editing,  I have been an associate editor of business book reviews for Small Business Trends, so I know what goes into a nonfiction and business book. I have also been a technical editor for two Pearson/Que publications, and consulted on books authored by Ramon Ray (The Small Business Guide To Facebook Marketing) and Marcus Hammonds ( God, Technology, and Us).
  • There are podcast opportunities ahead, and I will be presenting at three conferences where I can build interest for the books.
  • I also have support from the sites who I have contributed over the last 5 years. 

Donate a Pierre-Can-Help

You can donate this perk to a favorite non-profit or a small business of your choice (no Mulit-Level Marketing businesses). I am more than happy to provide a tailored workshop to explain a social media platform.  This is a $250 value for $65, so you are really receiving a good deal for this perk!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, you can help by sharing where possible.  Getting the word out gives feedback and offers new ideas, so sharing is certainly welcome.

Evernote is used to speed up the time it takes to do the dictation and refine the text.  Slack will be used with the designer to manage the book.
I have experience not only writing but in editing,  I have been an associate editor of business book reviews for Small Business Trends, so I know what goes into a nonfiction and business book. I have also been a technical editor for two Pearson/Que publications, and consulted on books authored by Ramon Ray (The Small Business Guide To Facebook Marketing) and Marcus Hammonds ( God, Technology, and Us).
There are podcast opportunities ahead, and I will be presenting at three conferences where I can build interest for the books.
I also have support from the sites who I have contributed over the last 5 years. 


Donate a Pierre-Can-Help
You can donate this perk to a favorite non-profit or a small business of your choice (no Mulit-Level Marketing businesses). I am more than happy to provide a tailored workshop to explain a social media platform.  This is a $250 value for $65, so you are really receiving a good deal for this perk!
Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, you can help by sharing where possible.  Getting the word out gives feedback and offers new ideas, so sharing is certainly welcome.

story:
ZoZo Children's Publishing Begins Now!

To engage today's children in a wide and varied world of modern literature, ZoZo will create an easy to use kid-friendly, off-line subscription app. Stories will be available in three languages: English, Spanish, and French. Children will have great literature at their fingertips- in the car, on the Metro, or anywhere! No WiFi is needed to access stories, games, and other educational content. Parents don't have to worry with ZoZo's app because there are no pop-ups or in-app purchase offers. The app is built for children with their well-being and interests in mind.

This Campaign for ZoZo Children's Publishing Is to help our creative team and back them with the technology needed to get a online "foot in the door." In a year form now our App will be out and our E-Books will be available directly for all Android and IOS devices. 

DIY Publishing 

My idea for a DIY publishing company started six years ago. My first story was written from a dream when I awoke from an afternoon nap. This story was just pen on paper until a friend motivated me to share it. The inspiration to create ZoZo Children's Publishing came when I left the United States to travel. Yes, it was the experience of traveling through countries and meeting wonderful artists and writers who felt they did not have a platform for their work that ZoZo Children's Publishing was born. 

ZoZo

The ZoZo came from a nickname for the youngest in my family, my niece Zoie. Her grandfather has given her the funny moniker of ZoZo, but my twin brother does not seem to like it very much. So to immortalize this family memory, I have named the company ZoZo Children's Publishing. 

The idea to self publish my own work and others did not just come from an overabundance of stories and art to share with the world. It also came from a past full of high hurdles jumped and hard goals accomplished. In the 80's, at school, it seemed there was no room for someone that did not read at a certain level. The problem continues today with large class sizes and regulated timed tests that leave some children grasping at straws. I was one of these kids- slipping through the cracks. How does a child with dyslexia make it through elementary school? I learned to fake it. That is right, I tricked my teachers and would pretend to read. This went unseen for a long time. Then when called on one to many times in the 4th grade to read in front of the class I new the "jig was up." They put me in a reading class. Only then did my eyes start to open to the world of reading and how reading can bring the rest of the world to you. 

Even though this was not that long ago, with the changes in technology, the world  is a very different place now. We all had to turn the TV channel with a nob and make phone calls to homes, not pockets. Now people can fast forward TV, and kids read books with a swipe of a finger. This might make teaching reading a lot easier, or it may make it even harder. Teaching kids that reading a webpage like this one is not the same as a "classic" starts at the basic level, as does a small company like this one. 

Help Karl with a K Reach His Goals!


Pick the perfect perk that peaks your perspective prerogative!

This is our first attempt at funding. We hope to make the full amount. The creative team for the App includes two French students and a mentor. Having these young students and an experienced leader at our disposal this summer is key to getting this App out on time. These young men are working with us as part of their summer internship, and a good part of the funding will go toward this. The advertising, media marketing, content writing, and other expenses  will all come second to the art and execution of the App.

 ZoZo Children's Publishing 

Here at ZoZo Children's Publishing, we know that the best way to do business is to stick to your word, and stay with your roots. ZoZo Children's Publishing is an artist- based publishing company focused on children's learning. One of the best things about living in this modern world is the new paths to take when it comes to publishing. With self publishing on the internet, anyone can make a dream come true. This project brings the world of storytelling to a new generation all in one place- teaching everything from reading, writing, and art to basic cognitive development. 



Now That You Are With Us!

By now you have picked a perk and want to know what else can you do to bring this App to the fingertips of children around the world!

1.  Share all our links on your pages and in groups on Facebook, Twitter, and Couchsurfing. If you are on these pages then we should connect!

Sarah Quinn's Couchsurfing

2. Calling all writers of blogs, travel pages, and makers of all the strange and wonderful pages here on the internet, please write an article about us! We can provide any content you may need.

3. Tell your friends and family! Word of mouth still counts for something in this world!

4. Writers with a story to tell are always welcome to contact us about publishing their work in our App, and artists are always needed to bring the next character to life!

 FIN

story:
Every book Post Mortem Press publishes has a title specific marketing plan. These plans are created to maximize awareness of the book within the budget provided. As a small press, our marketing budget is small and sadly, the most effective marketing efforts tend to be more expensive. 

Funds from this project will be used to supplement the plan, allowing for promotion outside the standard plan. 

For example, on-screen cinema advertising can be very effective when tied to personal appearances. But the cost of these ads can exceed our overall marketing budget for the book. Remember, we're small. 

Why should you help us? 

This is an obvious question and it's a hard one. The technological changes of the past decade or so have allowed for more authors to publish their work. As a result the marketplace is crowded. A way to be seen inside that crowd is through marketing. You or someone you know is probably familiar with Rock Neelly (the author) or Post Mortem Press (the publisher). Often people will offer assistance. "Let me know if there's anything I can do to help" is a familiar refrain. The best way to help an author is to buy their book and tell people about once you've finished reading it. This campaign allows you to purchase your book in advance and slipping in a little extra to help cover that marketing campaign. Plus, you get your name in a book and can prove you actually did know about Rock Neelly before he was famous, or is that infamous? 

What's in it for you? 

We've designed a unique group of perks to show our appreciation to those who are able to help us with this modest project. 

  • $10 eThanks  - Get an advanced eBook copy of The Purple Heart Detective Agency and your name listed in the publisher's acknowledgments.
  • $25 Doing it Buy the Book - Personally inscribed/autographed trade paperback copy of Rock Neelly's The Purple Heart Detective Agency. Your name will also be included in the publisher's acknowledgements. PLUS, some bonus SWAG.
  • $50 Trailblazer - Personally inscribed/autographed ADVANCED READER COPY (ARC) trade paperback of Rock Neelly's The Purple Heart Detective Agency. Take advantage of this rare opportunity to get your hands on one of only a few pre-release hard copy versions of the book. Your name will also be included in the publisher's acknowledgments. PLUS, some bonus SWAG.
  • $250 Medal of Honor – Limit ONE - We start with your very own inscribed/autographed paperback copy of The Purple Heart Detective Agency and your name will also be included in the publisher's acknowledgments. PLUS, some bonus SWAG. - THEN - Rock Neelly will write a special short story, using the The Purple Heart Detective Agency including a Tuckerization, where your name (or another name of your choice) is used as THE CLIENT in the story.  This short story will be used to promote the book release AND will be published as a deep discount standalone eBook making all your friends and family green with envy.
  • $250 Medal of (dis)Honor – Limit ONE - We start with your very own inscribed/autographed paperback copy of The Purple Heart Detective Agency and your name will also be included in the publisher's acknowledgements. PLUS, some bonus SWAG. - THEN - Rock Neelly will write a special short story, using the The Purple Heart Detective Agency including a Tuckerization, where your name (or another name of your choice) is used as THE ANTAGONIST (BAD GUY) in the story.  This short story will be used to promote the book release AND will be published as a deep discount standalone eBook making all your friends and family green with envy.
Beyond supporting marketing efforts, what else does this project hope to accomplish? 

One of the major challenges for an emerging author is to build an audience outside their circle of friends and family. As the publisher it is our aim to expand the author's reach.  We love it when a reader walks up to one of our authors, complete strangers, and the reader knows all about the author's work. Fandom at its purest level. 

Risks & Challenges

There's not much at risk here. The book will be released regardless of the results of this campaign. I guess the biggest risk is that we may miss some marketing opportunities that the extra funding could afford. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that as much as you may want to help, some people just can't afford to contribute. Trust me, we've been there. But there are some simple things you can do to help that won't require any money. 

  • Use the Indiegogo tools to share this campaign within your social media circles. You never know, that long lost high school acquaintance may have some money burning a hole in their pocket and this is exactly the way they want to spend it. 
  • When the book gets closer to release, join the legion of fans (okay, so maybe not a real legion) and help us raise awareness of the book. 

We know money and time are precious commodities and we greatly appreciate any assistance you may be able to provide.

story:
Help to purchase self-help books to enlighten Nigel Farage and the UKIP membership!   (And perhaps help them to move into the 21st Century!  This is an ambitious aim, of course, but I live in hope!)

The books I'd like to buy Nigel (and why he needs to read them!) are as follows: 

'Complete Idiots Guide to Breastfeeding' (Nigel Farage recently told women to breastfeed in a corner, without being 'ostentatious'.  But Nigel, breastfeeding is a natural, essential human process - babies need to be fed when they're hungry, and there's nothing ostentatious about a mother responding to that need.  ... So Nigel,  nobody puts baby in a corner!  ;)  boom boom!)

'Weather For Dummies'    and   'Global Warming For Dummies'   (A UKIP councillor came out with a bizarre homophobic rant blaming storms and heavy floods across Britain on the decision to legalise gay marriage.  And UKIP has previously pledged to ban climate change lessons in schools)

'Tracing Your Family History For Dummies' (Ancestry experts have revealed the great-grandfather of Nigel Farage was born to German parents who migrated to London in the 19th century.   In other words his ancestors were 'Johnny Foreigners'!  And ... shock, horror … Nigel Farage's wife, Kirsten, was born in Germany!   These 'foreigners' are everywhere, eh Nigel?)

'Answering Tough Interview Questions For Dummies'   (UKIP has been invited to take part in the televised leaders election debates, after all)

'Immigrants - Your Country Needs Them' and 'Racism, Xenophobia & Distribution'  (Nigel Farage blamed M4 traffic jams on immigrants after he was late for a £25-a-head 'Meet Nigel' UKIP event.  And a UKIP member once complained about the impact of immigration on the NHS, writing: “I am informed by past media that Black Caribbean and not Black African have a higher instance of schizophrenia.  I wonder if this is due to inbreeding on these small islands in slave times or is it due to ­smoking grass".  Former East Midlands UKIP chairman described illegal immigrants as "sandal-wearing, bomb-making, camel-riding, goat-f******, ragheads" on his Facebook page.)

'Homophobia - Deal With It'  (On the UKIP party’s official online “members ­forum”,  a senior UKIP member once branded gay rights a “lunatic’s charter” and claimed some homosexuals prefer sex with animals.  Another member, from UKIP's Bognor Regis branch in West Sussex, used the forum to attack gay sex as “disgusting”. He wrote: “What irritates me is the way they and their leftie, neo-Commie followers seem to want to force the rest of us to consider them as normal.  I just wish they would keep their ­homosexual nature and practices to ­themselves and stop trying to ram it down my throat telling me they are ‘normal’ when they are not”)

'Complete Idiots Guide to Meeting & Event Planning'  (Nigel Farage badly needs some advice on staging a party political event. UKIP party conferences are always a shambles!  For example, Godfrey Bloom turned the 2013 UKIP party conference into an embarrassment by telling a group of UKIP women they were "sluts". The remark followed his gaffe earlier when he said Britain should not send aid to "bongo bongo land")

'Red Flags of Narcissistic Personality Disorder'  (A senior UKIP figure said Nigel Farage is a 'control freak' in the way he runs the party. He said policy decisions were a 'sort of collective operation' but Mr Farage is the 'dominant figure' in the party'.  ... And, anyway, we all know how much Nigel loves himself!)

'A Little Book of Manners' (Nigel Farage is constantly criticised for his rudeness in the European Parliament - despite earning £79,000 a year - he earns a 'daily subsistence allowance' of £250 every time he attends the European Parliament, has an monthly EU allowance of £3,580 to cover UK travel, office management and running costs, and has his first-class travel to the continent covered) 

'Complete Idiots Guide to Throwing a Great Party' (There’s nothing like a great party …. And let’s face it, UKIP is NOTHING LIKE A GREAT PARTY)

'Complete Idiots Guide to Astrology' (Nigel Farage says he doesn't believe in Astrology.  But he is an Aries and they do tend to be sceptical  :) boom boom!)

'Raising Goats For Dummies'  (Hopefully, following a disastrous General Election for UKIP - including Nigel Farage being beaten in Thanet South by “Al Murray Pub Landlord” - Nigel Farage will push-off to a remote region of Nepal and farm goats!)





>>>> Please note: The minimum appeal amount permitted on this website is £500.  Any money actually donated will be given to charity!

running costs, and has his first-class travel to the continent covered) 'Complete Idiots Guide to Throwing a Great Party' (There’s nothing like a great party …. And let’s face it, UKIP is NOTHING LIKE A GREAT PARTY)

including Nigel Farage being beaten in Thanet South by “Al
Murray Pub Landlord” - Nigel Farage will push-off to a remote region of Nepal
and farm goats!)

minimum appeal amount permitted on this website is £500.  Any money actually donated will be given to charity!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY


COMANY: Tayen Lane Publishing was founded in 2012. Its mission--to challenge the status quo by publishing provocative, thought-provoking, beyond-the-mainstream books, that engage readers across a range of genres. We believe that the time is ripe for new voices, fresh ideas, alternative stories, and an evolutionary change of direction--a change that sets free a sea of perspectives.

We're looking for new perspectives that facilitate health (mental, physical, heart) and happiness, that give a compelling take on the world around us and that offer an informed of life. We want to give the underdog with a paradigm-callenging manuscript (fiction, non-fiction), a moving book of poetry, the opportunity to engage the world. 

Your support will help Tayen Lane to save writers everywhere and change the world, one great book at a time.

TEAM: The Tayen Lane Publishing team is comprised of a core group who, interestingly, have all loved reading, writing, and discovering new books, since we were little, itty-bitty children. It is a love that has never let us go and never let us down. 

  • Kermit Heartsong (Publisher) writer, author, inventor and entrepreneur, has developed several award-winning word games (Articulation, Word By Word), written three non-fiction books, and has published 33 fiction, nonfiction and poetry books. He's also co-developed and patented a vector-based, neurally-networked software engine for DNA mapping and agricultural, biomedical and astronomical data management (which, of course, has absolutely nothing to do with publishing). 
  • Bri Bruce (Editor) is an editor and graphic designer from Santa Cruz, California. She holds a bachelor’s degree in literature and creative writing from UC Santa Cruz. Her work has appeared in over twenty anthologies, magazines, and literary publications, including The Sun Magazine, Northwind Magazine, Soundings Review, and the Monterey Poetry Review. She was nominated for the Ina Coolbrith Memorial Poetry Prize in 2009 as a student of Santa Cruz’s first poet laureate, Gary Young, and in 2014 she was the recipient of the PushPen Press Pendant Prize for Poetry. She is the award-winning author of The Weight of Snow.
  • Natylie Baldwin (Associate Editor). Natylie’s fiction and nonfiction have appeared in various publications including Sun Monthly, Dissident Voice, Energy Bulletin, NewtopiaMagazine, The Common Line, New York Journal of Books and The Lakeshore. Natylie is the co-author of Ukraine: ZBig’s Grand Chessboard & How the West Was Checkmated. She is currently working on two novels to be published in late 2015 and early 2016. She is a graduate of Cal State East Bay and also enjoys walking, hiking, the beach, movies, and classic television dramas. Natylie lives in the San Francisco Bay Area.
  • Hollen Reischer (Associate Editor) has written, edited, and proofread over 6,000 pages of creative nonfiction, poetry, fiction, and K–12 curriculum. She is also a grant writer for mission-based organizations. She is an editor of SOILED, a creative architecture periodical, and the former editor of the community-based Journal of Ordinary Thought. Hollen has contributed to publications at the Neighborhood Writing Alliance, Interfaith Worker Justice, Umoja Student Development Corporation, and Orion’s Mind. She is a graduate of Duke University and has received honors for her commitment to dialogue, social justice, and leadership. Hollen lives in Oakland, California, where she enjoys the Bay Area’s food, flora, fauna, and creative bustle.
  • Emma Thurgood (Associate Acquisitions Editor) is not Desperately Seeking Susan (a film she watched with rapt fascination from her cradle), she’s desperately seeking talented writers and provocative manuscripts across the various genres supported by Tayen Lane Publishing. A graduate of the University of Cambridge, Emma joined Tayen Lane in 2014, after a stint with Shepheard-Walwyn, an independent publisher based in London. Emma is a voracious reader, a dabbler in martial arts (she holds black belts in judo and aikido), a failed fashion designer and a superhero when it comes to whipping up culinary delights


WITH YOUR HELP...

We'll be able to fund the development and publication of thirty (30) new books! Now how many people can say that they've helped to fund the publication of thirty  (30) unique books?!

The funding will be utilized to:

  • Cost effectively design each of the thirty new books
  • To publish and distribute each new book 
  • To market each book via INGRAM's semi-annual, worldwide book catalog (it goes to over 30,000 retailers!) and also via its internal distribution engine
  • To guerrilla market via social media and other appropriate venues
  • To hire part-time help (read: young graduates who want a cool job) to maintain our various social media campaigns and blogs

THE PERKS...

You're reviewing this campaign, quite possibly, because you're a lover of books. It only seems logical then, that your perks should be beautifully written, award-winning books, from writers--young and old--newly discovered.
However, should you be a "lover squared" of books and if you are able to contribute at the highest level, then you will:
  • Soon become an author with a well (ghost) written book (given that it complies with Tayen Lane Publishing's mandate-no hate)
  • Have a publishing contract with Tayen Lane
  • Travel free to San Francisco for a two-day working vacation. You'll need to meet with Tayen Lane's staff and your ghostwriter.

THE BENEFITS

Jessica Tyner, Pulitzer Prize, Griffin Trust, and Pushcart Prize nominated poet, published her first book with Tayen Lane. How her incredible talent went unnoticed and unappreciated was beyond us. The first stanza of her first poem to us, was alive and powerful, transportive and troubling. We were hooked immediately.

There are other poets and writers like Jessica, such as Andrea Rivas, Tristan Shaw, and Naomi Johnson, who are now writing for Tayen Lane. Please help us bring thirty (30) new beautiful, thought-provoking, and timely voices to the world.


POETRY

Jessica's poem, "Passing," was nominated for a Pushchart Prize. The poem is also part of her Pulitzer and Griffin Prize nominated book, The Last Exotic Petting Zoo.


Passing

I was twelve before I realized my father wasn’t white,
until then I thought nothing
of his clay colored skin, eyes dripping
like honey or ropes of black licorice hair
snaking alive and furious down his back.
My breasts sprung early, hips splayed
wide as an overeager invitation
with bones pushing unforgiving
against my own skin, pale and quiet
as the illness. You took me to Radio Shack,
your syrupy southern drawl wrapping like a shy gift
around the simple words,
My wife put something on hold,
and the young clerk, not a decade older than me,
looked at both of us with blatant disgust,
loathing and a shot of envy
even I could sniff out, like a dog
or a wild thing.
Is this your wife? he asked, and my chest
was in a painful awakening of an instant
freakishly large, my hips
unable to slam shut, and you
too stunned to be ashamed or angered just whispered,
That’s my daughter before walking out, the snakes gone still,
but for the years I’m too sorry to take back,
the years until the cancer sucked you dry,
I felt it for both of us,
felt it in my thighs built like a horse
and my lips too ripe for a child,
in every year after labor heavy year
I refused to be seen with you, I’m so sorry
that I saw you gut punched and ugly as a man.

Jessica Tyner


Wouldn't it be wonderful to help discover the next Walt Whitman, Mark Twain (Samuel Clemens), Agatha  Christie, or Dante, Rowling, Orwell, Kafka? We believe this would be a big an incredible win-win for book lovers across the world. Don't you?

Here's a poem from a poet published in our Poems from Conflicted Hearts poetry anthology. She, Maurine Killough, is also immensely talented.


The River Ganges

Magenta designs upon my hands
swirl and weave up my wrists
the gold glitters heavy on my ears my neck
the bindi is properly placed
and I am ready to be dressed

I could not brace it
could not greet the heave upon me
of this fate-fulfilling ritual
without a piece of him with me
to shield me from the celebrating eyes

I wrap his scarf around my heart
around my ribs
against my belly
to help me face
this ceremonial union

43 years forward
and I cannot endure it
cannot bear to move through the doorway
for this final ritual without a piece of him with me
to fortify me, shield me
from the hands and the tears
of this fateful union come apart

His wedding scarf is wrapped around my heart
my ribs and belly
this is the only way I can brave
this disembarkment
this departure of moving on without him

They gently wrap my body in the purest white
I am shrouded in marigolds
and I am gently given
to the Ganges River

Maurine Killough


FANTASY & SCIENCE FICTION

If you love fantasy and science fiction with an interesting twist, you'll definitely want to consider several of our new books from the 30-30 campaign. VURK KOLL is but one of those books, told from the  perspective of a rather interesting and unusual clan of Orcs, who may usher in the demise of humanity.

VURK KOLL: There are Orcs, and then there are the Krodun Mur Orcs with whom humans have had only a few skirmishes in recent years. Skirmishes that have left few human survivors. The survivor stories of the battles with the Krodun Mur Orcs have sown fear among all the races and even among the “Race of Man.” The stories have given the Krodun Mur what they value most—their peaceful isolation. And none value it more among the Krodun Mur, than Prince Vurk Koll. Yet, fear, as all races know, is but a pale wisp of an adversary to greed. War comes, and, as always, it comes to those who do not seek it. Human raiders, led by a tyrannical Lord, even now brazenly encroach Krodun Mur lands. War comes and the world will be undone.


NONFICTION

Love nonfiction books that actually give you a realistic picture of the world in which you live and what is truly going on based upon actual facts? We have a suite of books that do just that. 


AMERICA IS NOT BROKE: The unsustainability of the American economy is as familiar as the newscycle.  There is no money for social programs, no money to run the government, no money to cut taxes, and above all, we have to cut, cut, cut. But, what if it’s not true?

Instead of familiar complaints about the national debt, leading to just slicing a shrinking economic pie differently, or worse, to Austerity Economics, the reality is that we already have all the wealth we could ever need. 


CHILDREN'S BOOK


Fairy Tales & Fractured Fables will be a beautifully illustrated collection of children’s stories, fairy tales, and fables that are new, fresh and reinvented. The stories will transcend time, age, and imagination. The compendium will entertain and enlighten while providing morals to grow by. (And you’re never too old to grow in this way.)

If you have a modern fairy tale, fractured fable, or children’s story that you believe would be more than well-suited for Fairy Tales & Fractured Fables, then please do submit your story using our submission guidelines.


RISK & CHALLENGES

At this point the risk are relatively minor, as we are a business currently in operation, with thirty-three books on the market or in the pipeline. Failure to raise the full amount means that we will have to cut back on the number of new writers and debuting books.

We will, however, be able to provide supporters their perks, commensurate with their contribution to our campaign.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We'd also love your help in getting the word out to friends, family, and folks who just love, love, love books and can't get enough of them.

SHORT SUMMARY 



COMANY: Tayen Lane Publishing was founded in 2012. Its mission--to challenge the status quo by publishing provocative, thought-provoking, beyond-the-mainstream books, that engage readers across a range of genres. We believe that the time is ripe for new voices, fresh ideas, alternative stories, and an evolutionary change of direction--a change that sets free a sea of perspectives.

We're looking for new perspectives that facilitate health (mental, physical, heart) and happiness, that give a compelling take on the world around us and that offer an informed of life. We want to give the underdog with a paradigm-callenging manuscript (fiction, non-fiction), a moving book of poetry, the opportunity to engage the world. 
Your support will help Tayen Lane to save writers everywhere and change the world, one great book at a time.

TEAM: The Tayen Lane Publishing team is comprised of a core group who, interestingly, have all loved reading, writing, and discovering new books, since we were little, itty-bitty children. It is a love that has never let us go and never let us down. 



Kermit Heartsong (Publisher) writer, author, inventor and entrepreneur, has developed several award-winning word games (Articulation, Word By Word), written three non-fiction books, and has published 33 fiction, nonfiction and poetry books. He's also co-developed and patented a vector-based, neurally-networked software engine for DNA mapping and agricultural, biomedical and astronomical data management (which, of course, has absolutely nothing to do with publishing). 




Bri Bruce (Editor) is an editor and graphic designer from Santa Cruz, California. She holds a bachelor’s degree in literature and creative writing from UC Santa Cruz. Her work has appeared in over twenty anthologies, magazines, and literary publications, including The Sun Magazine, Northwind Magazine, Soundings Review, and the Monterey Poetry Review. She was nominated for the Ina Coolbrith Memorial Poetry Prize in 2009 as a student of Santa Cruz’s first poet laureate, Gary Young, and in 2014 she was the recipient of the PushPen Press Pendant Prize for Poetry. She is the award-winning author of The Weight of Snow.




Natylie Baldwin (Associate Editor). Natylie’s fiction and nonfiction have appeared in various publications including Sun Monthly, Dissident Voice, Energy Bulletin, NewtopiaMagazine, The Common Line, New York Journal of Books and The Lakeshore. Hollen lives in Oakland, California, where she enjoys the Bay Area’s food, flora, fauna, and creative bustle.

A graduate of the University of Cambridge, Emma joined Tayen Lane in 2014, after a stint with Shepheard-Walwyn, an independent publisher based in London. Emma is a voracious reader, a dabbler in martial arts (she holds black belts in judo and aikido), a failed fashion designer and a superhero when it comes to whipping up culinary delights
