story:
This competition has been initiated by an 8 year old child, Bethany. She has been raising money for elephants for the last 2 years at market stalls. Now she wants to combine her two passions- creative writing and helping elephants to inspire other children to help elephants too.

We would like to run a writing contest for children aged between 5-16 years to help raise awareness and funds to sponsor elephants in reputable elephant sanctuaries in Asia or Africa. We are raising funds to cover the cost of prizes so that we do not have to ask children to pay an entry fee. Entry fees may deter kids from entering. 

The prizes that we would like to offer are:

5-8years: Sponsorship/adoption of an elephant for one year + surprise pack

9-12 years: Sponsorship/adoption of an elephant for one year + surprise pack

13-16 years: Sponsorship/adoption of an elephant for one year + surprise pack

Second prize for each category would be a surprise pack of elephant related items.Bethany would like to include information about elephants, a poster, arm bands, postcards, and perhaps a toy elephant in the surprise pack.

Sponsorship would only involve reputable elephant sanctuaries in either Africa or Asia. We would provide the winners with a range of organisations to choose from with the help of the charity known as Kids For Elephants, whom Bethany has been involved with since 2013.

Bethany has entered several writing contests and been short-listed and also came second in the Laura Literary Awards in 2013. I would help Bethany to judge the writing contest. I am a qualified primary teacher, and also a publisher and editor who runs an adult writing competition each year.

We would promote the competition through schools and through writer networks. Bethany will also write a blog and offer her knowledge of elephants and her journey as a fundraiser, as well as updates on the competition.

If we received enough entries or more funding, we may also be able to offer selected stories/authors the opportunity to be printed in a book which could help raise further funds for elephants.

Bethany became passionate about elephants at about 2 years of age. She was aware that her great grandfather was Burmese and lived with elephants, which captured her imagination. Her great grandfather and great grandmother collected hand made ornaments of elephants on their visits to Burma and Thailand. Bethany has inherited some of these ornaments recently. This year her great grandfather has passed away and we are making a special trip to Burma and Thailand to introduce Bethany to her ancestral roots and to give Bethany to opportunity to work with elephants.

If you can help us by donating today we will be most appreciative. Alternatively if you can share this campaign in your social networks this would be fantastic. 

Together we hope to encourage children to write creatively and learn about elephants.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Dan Close, and I’m here to introduce you to my latest novel. I visited Quebec City for the first time in 1964, and found myself in the middle of what was to be called “Quebec’s Quiet Revolution”. That hot summer inspired this novel, “Song of Quebec”. The people I met, their ideas and ideals and their stories serve as the basis for the tale I want to share with you:

A United States government official is assassinated in the streets of Quebec City. Thus begins a story including intrigue, spies of many nations, revolutionaries, and romance that culminates in the great battle for Quebec sovereignty. This is not as far-fetched as it may seem. The Front de Liberation du Quebec (FLQ) actually had plans to kidnap the U S Consul-General of Montreal. While they did not succeed in this attempt, they did kidnap a British Trade Commissioner, and did murder the Quebec Minister of Labor. And when President of France Charles de Gaulle shouted in a speech in Montreal, “Vive La Quebec! Vive La Quebec Libre!”, it caused an international incident. These occurrences, along with the bombs, riots, and threats indicate that the “quiet” revolution was not really that quiet. It is against this background that the action of “Song of Quebec” occurs.

What We Need & What You Get

I need your help to make this novel a reality. So please take a look around, check out my perks, and read on. I’m looking to raise $5,500.00 to cover costs for this book. These include…Editing and Review $2250; Initial printing $1300; Marketing $1500; Miscellaneous costs/Indiegogo cut $450. I have some great perks to offer you in return for your help funding this book. For instance: $10 gets you a research directory guiding you through this period. $25 gets you an e-book copy of the book. $45 gets you a special first edition copy of the book, numbered and signed by the Author. If you’re feeling extra generous, $550.00 gets you two nights for two at a traditional upper-town hotel, the same one that our hero, Jack Kearney, stayed at (maybe, if you’re lucky, even the room he stayed in!). Also included is a carriage ride about town and a tour of action sites from the novel, led by the Author. Plus many more options!

The Impact

The impact of the funding is primarily on the author and his ability to control the marketing of his project. I have written and marketed three books so far, and by now I have learned a lot. I know what to do, and where the levers of power are found in the publishing business. I also know the value of a good, comprehensive plan that includes traditional books, e-books, and offshoot versions of both. That plan must cover local, national, and international markets. It must be, at the beginning and throughout, an active campaign. It should contain enough capital to sustain it through its initial stages, until it begins to generate financial solidity on its own. It should not be done piecemeal, with the author doing this, that, and the other thing as money becomes available. While the campaign might be an emotional rollercoaster, the financial aspect of it must be a smooth-riding, seasoned, closer-to-reality vehicle.  In other words, it must be a campaign grounded in financial reality. I would like to start here, among my friends old and new, and among others who find the theme of the book attractive and have faith in my ability to carry the project through to success. And to reward my backers with perks. Neat perks! Don’t forget, you get some neat perks with this program!

What if we don't reach our goal?

The most important parts of this venture are editing and publication. If we don’t reach our goal, whatever net amount we do obtain will be spent on those initial activities, and, of course, on the earned perks of our backers. We will keep all of our backers informed at the very least on a monthly basis of our progress, as of course we will also do if we reach our goal, or exceed it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute but would still like to help, that’s great! I’d love to have your support in any form it might take. So, you might consider spreading the word among your friends about this campaign. Hopefully, if all goes well, we can make this book happen quickly and have it ready for the holiday season, where three-quarters of all copies of all books are sold. Thank you for your help, should you choose to give it. We are off on a great adventure! Please join us!

Dan Close

VIDEO BELOW:  THE TEAM OFFERS INSIGHT INTO GOBE GREETINGS' WORK OF INSPIRING CONNECTIONS EVERYDAY,


ANY OF THESE SPONSOR PACKAGES WILL HELP US PUBLISH THIS CHILDREN'S BOOK.  WE'VE DESIGNED THE INSPIRATIONAL GREETINGS FOR EVERY AGE.

Thanks for believing that the smallest of stuff can make the biggest of difference.  Everyday.  If you have any questions, please connect to me.  I look forward to hear from you, 

                                                                                                                               

TO UNDERSTAND THE REALITY OF ISSUES FACING KIDS:

UNICEF: 2014 - KIDS BY THE NUMBERS

NY TIMES: 2014 ONE OF WORST YEARS TO BE A CHILD

THE STAR: TORONTO CHILD POVERTY RATE AT 'EPIDEMIC' LEVELS (AUG 2014)

For campaign investments, business development or media kits, please email Nick.

For creative insight, marketing and partnerships, please email Jason.

For the Everyday Blog: Power of Positivity, please email Anna here.

For Postcards from the Classroom come to your classroom, please email Renza here.

POSTCARDS FROM THE CLASSROOM:  PLEASE INQUIRE OR VISIT HERE.

THE WONDER WALLS FOCUS GROUP: JOIN OUR BRIEF 5-QUESTION SURVEY HELP US SHAPE THE WONDER WALLS® CHARACTERS AND CONTENT. REQUIREMENT:  (1) ADULT (OVER 18 YRS OF AGE) AND (1) CHILD (AGES 6-11 YEARS);  PLEASE LEARN MORE BY VISITING HERE.



HERE'S A RECAP OF HOW YOU CAN HELP GIVE US A JUMP-START:


  •  INVEST IN ONE OF OUR SPONSORSHIP PACKAGES ($10/ $25/ $50/ $125)
  • ANSWER THE INVESTOR-PICKS SURVEY ONCE YOU PURCHASE A SPONSORSHIP PACKAGE (YOUR OPINION ON FAVOURITE ITEMS)

  • SHARE OUR VIDEO OR LINK WITH YOUR FRIENDS OR SOCIAL MEDIA
  • JOIN OUR FACEBOOK, TWITTER OR LINKEDIN SITES
  • VOTE FOR YOUR QUOTE BY VISITING THE WONDER WALLS® PAGE HERE
  • HAVE YOUR NAME BE YOUR VOICE TO HAVE IT PRINTED IN OUR PUBLISHED 1ST EDITION (LIMITED TO 33 SPONSORS AT $125).
  • VISIT OUR STORE TO SEE OTHER GREETINGS & COMMUNICATION TOOLS
  • BECOME A RETAIL PARTNER AND CARRY OUR PRODUCTS. LEARN MORE.
  • CONNECT WITH US.  SEND FEEDBACK ABOUT WHAT WORKS FOR YOU AND WHAT MIGHT NOT. 
  • CHECK OUT OUR MAY & JUNE 2015 SCHEDULE OF CHILDREN-FOCUSED EVENTS IN TORONTO TO EMPOWER YOUTH WITH CREATIVE TOOLS.


If you have any questions regarding the various investment packages, what they include, or if you are interested in a greater investment opportunity, please email Jason here.

For sales inquiries, fundraising opportunities, please email here.

VOTE FOR YOUR QUOTE.  Please cast your vote here until June 7, 2015.

story:
Short Summary

We want to share some poetry-love and invite you to be part of one of Florida’s biggest literary celebrations ever!  YellowJacket Press (YJP)  is a non-profit, independent poetry publisher founded in 2005 and located in Tampa, Florida.  Our mission is to unite poets and audiences. In a literary labor of love, YJP has published over 30 small collections of poetry (chapbooks) by Florida poets. This year, YJP is celebrating our 10th Anniversary. Our project is to publish a major anthology of poetry showcasing work by some of the best poets living and writing in Florida today—our YJP poets.  To debut the anthology in fall 2015, we’ll have two fabulous launches—one in the Tampa Bay area and one at the Other Words Conference in St. Augustine.  We are all-volunteer, so every dollar you contribute goes to POETRY.


What We Need & What You Get

The goal for our project is to raise $4,500. Funds raised will be used to publish and distribute copies of the 10th Anniversary Anthology ($2000), pay honoraria to our poets ($2,000) and host the launch parties ($500).  As always, our editors will donate their expertise, energy and time. If we don’t reach our goal, we will scale back our launch parties.  We will NOT cut honoraria. 

Donation levels range from $1--$1,000, so there is a level for everyone. Each supporter of $10 or more receives a prize from YJP, everything from an acknowledgement in the anthology, to copies of the book, VIP seating at the launches, and even a Poetry Happy Hour with founding editor Gianna Russo and other YJP board members. 

The Impact

Founded on an unswerving devotion to poetry, poets and audiences and a dedication to volunteerism, YellowJacket Press has established itself as the gold standard in commitment to the literary arts and chapbook publishing in Florida.

Through the poetry-love of our founding editor, Gianna Russo; Assistant Editor, Silvia Curbelo, and over a dozen current and past board members, we have successfully funded and published 2-6 poetry chapbooks a year for the past 10 years.  We have published chapbooks by three Florida regional Poets Laureate: Mary Jane Ryals (Big Bend), Peter Meinke (St. Petersburg) and James Tokley, (Hillsborough County). We’ve published poets from Tallahassee to Jacksonville, Miami to Orlando.  You could say YJP is Florida's public servant to poetry.

The 10th Anniversary Anthology will allow poets, audiences and fans from across the state to celebrate the poetry-love of the past ten years and preserve Florida’s poetic heritage of the early 21st century. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Join us in creating this milestone celebration of Florida poetry by participating in the 10th Anniversary Anthology Project.  Even if you can’t donate money, we can still use your help. Please share the project with friends and on your social media sites (you can use the Indiegogo share tools) . You’ll get our eternal poetry-love!

Anniversary Anthology ($2000), pay honoraria to our poets ($2,000) and host the
launch parties ($500).  As always,
our editors will donate their expertise, energy and time. If we don’t reach our
goal, we will scale back our launch parties.  We
will NOT cut honoraria.  
Donation levels range from $1--$1,000, so there is a
level for everyone. Each supporter of $10 or more receives a prize from YJP,
everything from an acknowledgement in the anthology, to copies of the book, VIP
seating at the launches, and even a Poetry Happy Hour with founding editor
Gianna Russo and other YJP board members. 


The Impact
 
Founded on
an unswerving devotion to poetry, poets and audiences and a dedication to volunteerism, YellowJacket Press has
established itself as the gold standard in commitment to the literary arts and
chapbook publishing in Florida. 
Through the poetry-love of our founding editor, Gianna
Russo; Assistant Editor, Silvia Curbelo, and over a dozen current and past
board members, we have successfully funded and published 2-6 poetry chapbooks a
year for the past 10 years.  We have
published chapbooks by three Florida regional Poets Laureate: Mary Jane Ryals
(Big Bend), Peter Meinke (St. Petersburg) and James Tokley, (Hillsborough
County). We’ve published poets from Tallahassee to Jacksonville, Miami to
Orlando.  You could say YJP is Florida's
public servant to poetry. 
The 10th
Anniversary Anthology will allow poets, audiences and fans from across the
state to celebrate the poetry-love of the past ten years and preserve Florida’s poetic heritage of the early 21st
century. 

    Other Ways You Can Help 
Join us in creating this milestone
celebration of Florida poetry by participating in the 10th Anniversary
Anthology Project.  Even if you can’t
donate money, we can still use your help. Please share the project with friends
and on your social media sites (you can use the Indiegogo share tools) . You’ll get our eternal poetry-love!

story:
Hello Beautiful People!

I'm excited to share that I've completed a screenplay that I'm going to turn into a Novel!  I'm really pumped about this project as I've already received interest from industry professionals that have been very encouraging.  

What I Need & What You Get

In order to make this happen, and have it be a success, I need to hire someone help me structure and edit the novel.  I've already completed the first phase of the project and will be starting the next phase shortly.  What I need to make this happen is about $20,000 from start to finish.  The process should take about a year to complete.  Having the proper guidance and expertise from a best selling author is invaluable to me and what I need to make this happen.  

The Impact

I plan on completing this project regardless of the funds that are contributed.  I say this to let you all know how determined I am to complete this and make it a success.  But I can't do it alone.  Your contributions will not only help me financially, but will also serve vital encouragement and faith that I need to make this happen in a timely manner.  

Risks & Challenges

As most of you know, I am a chiropractor and small business owner.  I run my own practice, by myself.  I also have two small children that I'm raising, thankfully, not by myself.  I've managed to handle all these responsibilities and complete a screenplay within a year.  I know that I can do this and make it successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

I also have a GoFundMe campaign, but I've decided to have one here as well since you are able to contribute via PayPal from indiegogo.  If you are tight on funds, I totally understand.  Every dollar counts, but if you can't contribute, please share this campaign with others in your circle of friends.  

Encouragement and support of all kinds are more than welcome!

Thank you for your faith and encouragement!

story:
Des contes que j'ai gardés et chéris et qu'il est temps de livrer.  Il me semblait important de proposer un ouvrage artisanal, fait main, pour sortir du livre publié et livré à grande échelle exposé dans une vitrine pareil à un objet inanimé.  Un livre publié est vivant, il passe de main en main, l'auteur et l'illustrateur l'offrent et portent leur passion

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

La somme permettra de réaliser environ 300  livres fabrication artisanale

L'impact

Souvent, on m'a demandé la publication de ces contes chamanes et finalement, il me semblait important de les diffuser. 

Risques et défis

Plusieurs publications ont vu le jour via des maisons d'édition, mais le livre artisanal est plus beau et il fait travailler des artisans. 

D'autres façons d'aider

Personnellement, je soutiens aussi d'autres projets en lien avec la paix dans le monde et s'entraider peut aussi améliorer la vie de tout un chacun

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tatiana Scutari, and I am from Moldova, a small country near Romania. I've recently moved to Dublin and started a new project - a website that promotes vegan lifestyle and cuisine.

The site has several categories:  recipes, stories, interviews, reviews and video. I write about people and their experiences, about the food I eat and books I read. Why "the vegan journalist"? Because both journalism and vegan lifestyle are my passions. For many years, I have been a TV and newspaper journalist. Not it is time to use this skills for a better purpose: promoting animal rights and vegan way of living.

I want to help the world to become less cruel and more human.

What We Need & What You Get

Why I've done so far? With the help of professionals, we've created the site. It is some work to do and we will launch it. 

What I need now is a proffesional camera to make good photos and video. 

The Impact

The website will be available in 3 languages: Romanian (my native language), Russian and English. It will give free vegan and raw vegan recipes and also documented articles about vegan lifestyle and its benefits for the planet, animals, environment and humans.
This site will help both those who want to become vegans and people who already have this lifestyle.  You will finds articles about vegan events, projects, business - text and video. 

My goal is to spread the idea of veganism and also to help people make the transition to this way of life.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is doing the content with a simple phone camera. As a result, images and videos will get less quality and therefore will be less interesting.

What I do at the moment is to prepare the content using a simple camera. It's good, but I need more to reach other standards. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are vegan, you can send me your ideas and believes and we can make world a better place for animals and people.

If you can not contribute, please, share my idea.

story:
My Children's Books

I'm Nicolette, a young writer coming out of college, and my 3 unique, thoughtful children's books are ready to be published online!

All that is left to do is to copyright them; and I'm hoping to raise the money to do so by offering free digital copies of whichever books I can copyright to contributors!

I want to publish my books, and share them with lots of little kids by taking them along on these inspiring tales of adventure, curiosity, creativity, drive, and compassion.


Goals and Prizes

  • $200 = copyright 1 book (all contributors get the e-book!)
  • $400 = copyright 2 books (all contributors get both e-books!)
  • $600 = copyright all 3 books (all contributors get all 3 e-books!)

The Books!

  1. "Emerson the Elephant's First Case"- Emerson is a curious, creative young elephant; so when his painting goes missing, he puts on his detective hat and gets to work solving his very first case!

    This is my most recent book, and has potential to become a series of Emerson the Elephant detective stories. 
  2. "The Sleeping Dragon"- Princess Khloe loves soaring through the clouds with her best friend, Jack, the dragon! But when he comes down with a case of Sleeping Sickness, Princess Khloe must embark on a daring quest to save him.



  3. "To Touch the Stars"- Amara wants to touch the stars, so she builds herself a spaceship, and (with her cat Bailey in tow, of course,) takes to the cosmos! 

Where the Books Came From

When I was born, my cousin Sean (who was 8 years old at the time) wrote a book for a class assignment, and he dedicated it to me. I still have it on my shelf. Almost 2 decades later, when Sean and his wife Courtney had their first child, I decided to write a book for them in return.

Since then, with every new addition to our family, I have written, illustrated, and colored a book for the new baby. And now, I have three complete, thoughtful children's books, each created with love and care. 

Why I'm Writing

In May, I graduated from Chapman University with a degree in TV Writing and Production. Since I've been living with chronic pain for the past 1.5 years, I have been unable to pursue that part of my career at this time. But that hasn't stopped me writing, creating, or innovating. I care about storytelling, and I'm going to keep sharing my tales any way I can!

Share far and wide!

If this is a project you are passionate about, feel free to spread the word!

THANK YOU!
Nicolette

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Dragana. I am the master of communication, public speaking.

I want to set up a school of public speaking and this book would be an essential tool for the work of my students.  The book is the result of my research in the field of public communication and includes explanations of the communication process, technology, mass media, the personality of the communicator, overcoming stage fright, audience, verbal and non-verbal communication as well as communication skills in a variety of mass media. Name of the book is "IN PUBLIC"-skills of public speaking and presentation in mass media.

The book is completed and money is required for the disclosure and printing. Publisher's NGO Association of Creators of Nis, of which I am vice-president.

The publication of this book will mean a lot to me in my future work and many people who want to improve these skills.

What We Need & What You Get

For the publication of a book that has 190 pages and is printed in 300 copies it is necessary to do the following:

Payment for cataloging and ISBN number of the agency for publishing - 40 euros

Print - 460 euros


The Impact

Today, the public speech used in all new systems of communication as a tool for achieving better success, greater credibility and higher profits.

Our success largely depends on how well we present it in the first contact with other people.

Are we going to successfully present employer, pupils, students, voters, customers and the general public depends solely on our personality, abilities, verbal and nonverbal communication, knowledge of audience we are addressing and media technology which transmits the message.

A small number of people have a talent for personal presentation, however, communication skills can be mastered learning and good training.

This book was created as a result of my long (17 years) work in public relations and my scientific research public communications. I wish to convey my knowledge and secrets of this craft as wide population to all those in need: youth leaders, employees, associations, unions, public officials and all those who wants to improve their skills.

Risks & Challenges

At this point the only disadvantage would be that not enough money to publish books.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially, you can help by making and to expand this campaign to as many friends
  • And please  use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
"If given the chance, we can all achieve great things." ~Gabe

My name is Gabe Howard and I live with bipolar and anxiety disorders and I want to write a memoir that is unlike other memoirs. I want to write about my life through the lens of a regular guy living with bipolar disorder.  I want this to be the "anti-memoir" and I promise it will not include the following:

  • Celebrities!  I'm not famous. I'm a regular person, just like my readers.

  • Sensational stories of mania, spending, and debauchery!  I was never arrested, didn't spend millions of dollars, and everything I went through could be duplicated if one has the desire to do so. (Though I don't recommend it.)

  • Bullsh*t!  My story, and the stories of all the people I met along the way, are real. In the movie version, Hollywood would no doubt dress it up by playing sad music and asking Morgan Freeman to narrate, but at the end of the day, my life isn't pretty. It will all be there: the good, the bad, and the parts that still keep me up some nights. 

I will write a book that shows what day-to-day life before, during, and after a bipolar diagnosis looks like. Of course I displayed "crazy" manic behavior -- I assure you that drugs, alcohol, and sex were heavily involved. But, you'll be surprised at what that really looks like without pop culture's "spit shine." 

I will showcase what worked, what didn't, and highlight the effect it had on my friends, family, and (of course) me. I'm not going to tell a story about life with bipolar disorder, I'm going to help the reader understand what it is like to live a life with bipolar disorder.

Anyone can write a book with themselves as the hero. Since I'm an atypical person, it shouldn't be a surprise that I will produce an atypical book. If you want to read about a relatable, average person, who grew up blue collar middle class, went through a lot of sh*t, and emerged intact, then this will be the memoir for you.

Otherwise, I recommend Carrie Fisher's Wishful Drinking. She's Princess Leia and her story is amazing. 




I am the previous author of Anxiety-Schmanxiety on HealthyPlace, the current author of Don't Call Me Crazy on PsychCentral.com (where I am also an Associate Editor), I write bi-weekly for bp magazine,  and am often featured on ElephantJournal.com. (I'm also the guy who wrote "Mental Illness is an A**hole." and "3 Ways to Stop Blaming Yourself for Bipolar Disorder.)

I've won a stack of awards, too, for writing (Best of the Web Award), for advocacy (one was from Mental Health America), and for all I do to educate society. I was even a WEGO Health Finalist.  

All of this is not to brag, but to show you that I know what I am doing. 

(Want to know more? Read my full bio here.)




What I Need & What You Get

I need your support. Financial, emotional, and mental -- I need it all. However, I have created this fundraising page to ask you to support me financially.

Over the past five years, I have put up tens of thousands of dollars and thousands of hours of unpaid work. I need your support to get me to the finish line. 

It may seem like I'm asking you to invest in this project, but I'm really asking you to invest in me. Together, we can release a book that changes the way society sees people living with bipolar disorder and other mental illnesses. 

Among the perks for your support are things like recognition in the book, early copies of the book, the ability to be a test reader, and bi-weekly updates. I'll sign your copy however you want. Donate enough and I'll hand deliver the completed product. 

But, more than anything, you get to be a part of this project. You get to help me realize the dream of changing the way people see bipolar disorder. Every single person who reads this memoir will likely see bipolar in a different light. Because we are more than an illness. Society needs to see everything I've been through and that will help them understand. 

You will get to help give life to my story that has so far taken 39 years to tell. (Because I'm 39 years old. Try and keep up.)




What Will I do With Your Investment?

This campaign is for the promotional side of this project: book blog tours, mailing out sample copies to reviewers and influencers, general advertising, etc. The greatest book in the world won't succeed if no one knows it exists.

Stretch goals include hiring a publicist to create a real world book tour to get me, and this book, in front of as many people as people. The goal is to change the way people see those living with bipolar disorder, so they need to see me. They need to read what I have to say and they need to understand.

Finally, 50% of the funds raised will go to credit card fees, shipping costs, and providing the products to fulfill the incentives for my backers. People like you.

Thank you. You are all #awesomepotatoes!


Testimonials 

 

 

"My name is Liza Long, author of The Price of Silence: A Mom's Perspective on Mental Illness and the article, "I am Adam Lanza's Mother." I want to tell you about a book campaign by bipolar writer and speaker, Gabe Howard, about living with ‪#‎bipolar‬ in the 'real world.' He needs our support and it well worth checking it.

“Gabe, who lives with bipolar, has helped me, as a parent, understand those challenges and my son's daily, heroic struggle not only to manage his mental illness, but to thrive. Please look at Gabe's Indiegogo campaign and join in. I support him and hope you will, too."

~Liza Long


"I am not only impressed with the impact that Gabe has made as a writer on the subject of bipolar disorder but also how he has taken the lead when it comes to advocating for a population of people who suffer silently with mental illness. His passion, ability to both mobilize and motivate and his charisma are unparalleled. And his work, whether it is writing or speaking, is changing the face of bipolar disorder. I hope that you'll support one of the most talented mental health advocates I know in sharing his story with others to help improve and save lives."

~ Andy Behrman
Author, Electroboy: A Memoir of Mania
Published by: Random House publishing company
New York Times Best Seller


"Gabe represents a new voice in the bipolar disorder world. He speaks with experience and offers a perspective that is lacking in mental health today: the perspective of being a guy with this illness. We need more books by men about the male experience of having bipolar disorder. We need men who manage the illness to speak up and let all of us know what it’s like to wake up with bipolar disorder and succeed. Gabe represents what we can accomplish when we look at our illness directly and say, 'OK, this sucks, now what am I going to do about it?' I learn from Gabe. He writes in a clear style that I love. It’s one that directly translates into great memoirs. I’m excited to read his book and fully support his project."

~ Julie A. Fast 
Author of Loving Someone with Bipolar Disorder, Take Charge of Bipolar Disorder, Get it Done When You’re Depressed and the BP Magazine column "Fast Talk."
www.JulieAFast.com


"Gabe brings a unique perspective and a unique energy to the subject of mental health. I am inspired by his passion and commitment to the blunt truth about what it means to live with a mental illness. Through writing, speaking, and advocacy, Gabe has a powerful impact on so many lives. I am grateful to know him."

~ Mike Veny
National Mental Health Speaker
www.TransformingStigma.com


"There are two things about Gabe's story that stand out, to me. The first is that his is a true story of bouncing back. He lost a lot in the times just prior to and immediately following his diagnosis. Despite these enormous setbacks, he has fought his way forward to become a fierce advocate for the mentally ill. The second thing is that he tells his story with honesty and integrity, warts and all. And that makes him entirely relatable."

~ Vincent M. Wales
Speculative Fiction Author and Mental Health Consumer
www.vincentmwales.com





Being Unable to Donate Doesn't Mean You're Unable to Help

Please help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Make a personal ask to people you know -- explain to them why YOU care about this project.
Please Note: You can purchase extra bipolar shirts (that do not support this project but do support me) and have it shipped ASAP by clicking over to my merchandise page on my website. Thank you.

What I Need & What You Get



I need your support. Financial, emotional, and mental -- I need it all. However, I have created this fundraising page to ask you to support me financially.
Over the past five years, I have put up tens of thousands of dollars and thousands of hours of unpaid work. I need your support to get me to the finish line. 
It may seem like I'm asking you to invest in this project, but I'm really asking you to invest in me. Together, we can release a book that changes the way society sees people living with bipolar disorder and other mental illnesses. 
Among the perks for your support are things like recognition in the book, early copies of the book, the ability to be a test reader, and bi-weekly updates. I'll sign your copy however you want. Donate enough and I'll hand deliver the completed product. 
But, more than anything, you get to be a part of this project. You get to help me realize the dream of changing the way people see bipolar disorder. Every single person who reads this memoir will likely see bipolar in a different light. Because we are more than an illness. Society needs to see everything I've been through and that will help them understand. 
You will get to help give life to my story that has so far taken 39 years to tell. (Because I'm 39 years old. Try and keep up.)







What Will I do With Your Investment?
This campaign is for the promotional side of this project: book blog tours, mailing out sample copies to reviewers and influencers, general advertising, etc. The greatest book in the world won't succeed if no one knows it exists.

Stretch goals include hiring a publicist to create a real world book tour to get me, and this book, in front of as many people as people. The goal is to change the way people see those living with bipolar disorder, so they need to see me. They need to read what I have to say and they need to understand.

Finally, 50% of the funds raised will go to credit card fees, shipping costs, and providing the products to fulfill the incentives for my backers. People like you. 

Thank you. You are all #awesomepotatoes!


Testimonials 


 

 

"My name is Liza Long, author of The Price of Silence: A Mom's Perspective on Mental Illness and the article, "I am Adam Lanza's Mother." I want to tell you about a book campaign by bipolar writer and speaker, Gabe Howard, about living with ‪#‎bipolar‬ in the 'real world.' He needs our support and it well worth checking it.
“Gabe, who lives with bipolar, has helped me, as a parent, understand those challenges and my son's daily, heroic struggle not only to manage his mental illness, but to thrive. Please look at Gabe's Indiegogo campaign and join in. I support him and hope you will, too."
~Liza Long

"I am not only impressed with the impact that Gabe has made as a writer on the subject of bipolar disorder but also how he has taken the lead when it comes to advocating for a population of people who suffer silently with mental illness. His passion, ability to both mobilize and motivate and his charisma are unparalleled. And his work, whether it is writing or speaking, is changing the face of bipolar disorder. I hope that you'll support one of the most talented mental health advocates I know in sharing his story with others to help improve and save lives."
~ Andy BehrmanAuthor, Electroboy: A Memoir of ManiaPublished by: Random House publishing companyNew York Times Best Seller

"Gabe represents a new voice in the bipolar disorder world. He speaks with experience and offers a perspective that is lacking in mental health today: the perspective of being a guy with this illness. We need more books by men about the male experience of having bipolar disorder. We need men who manage the illness to speak up and let all of us know what it’s like to wake up with bipolar disorder and succeed. Gabe represents what we can accomplish when we look at our illness directly and say, 'OK, this sucks, now what am I going to do about it?' I learn from Gabe. He writes in a clear style that I love. It’s one that directly translates into great memoirs. I’m excited to read his book and fully support his project."
~ Julie A. Fast Author of Loving Someone with Bipolar Disorder, Take Charge of Bipolar Disorder, Get it Done When You’re Depressed and the BP Magazine column "Fast Talk."www.JulieAFast.com
"Gabe brings a unique perspective and a unique energy to the subject of mental health. I am inspired by his passion and commitment to the blunt truth about what it means to live with a mental illness. Through writing, speaking, and advocacy, Gabe has a powerful impact on so many lives. I am grateful to know him."
~ Mike VenyNational Mental Health Speakerwww.TransformingStigma.com

"There are two things about Gabe's story that stand out, to me. The first is that his is a true story of bouncing back. He lost a lot in the times just prior to and immediately following his diagnosis. Despite these enormous setbacks, he has fought his way forward to become a fierce advocate for the mentally ill. The second thing is that he tells his story with honesty and integrity, warts and all. And that makes him entirely relatable."
~ Vincent M. WalesSpeculative Fiction Author and Mental Health Consumerwww.vincentmwales.com









Being Unable to Donate Doesn't Mean You're Unable to HelpPlease help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools.
Make a personal ask to people you know -- explain to them why YOU care about this project.







Please Note: You can purchase extra bipolar shirts (that do not support this project but do support me) and have it shipped ASAP by clicking over to my merchandise page on my website. Thank you.

story:
BING VS. THE J-CREW IS NOW AVAILABLE FOR PREORDER AT 
nadinejohnsonbooks.com
I love writing books that encourages children to believe in themselves and their dreams. I've published five inspiring picture books over the past eight years, and this is my first chapter book.

Bing vs. the J-Crew is a light-hearted, hilarious chapter book with tons of illustrations that children will love. It's for ages 7-9 (approx.).

Bing is a bird-loving, science nut who just wants to make it through the last ten days of school. He also wouldn’t mind being crowned Science Student of the Year on Awards Day. However, the J-Crew (Chad and Braxton) is not going to make it easy for him. They are planning the ultimate prank for Bing.

When Bing overhears them plotting, he devises a crazy plan to avoid them for the rest of the year. After his plan flops, Bing joins forces with his best friend, Joni, to stop them before it’s too late. Will Chad and Braxton turn Bing into a stinky stinker, or will Bing and Joni crush their plan?

Bing vs. the J-Crew is a fun read, and it has many important lessons for this age group as well. While Bing faces his fears, he learns he's a lot braver than he thought. He shows how to be a great friend and how to forgive. Also, as Bing tries to apply what happens in the birds' world to his own world, he learns that unlike mockingbirds and crows, children who are different can come together and be friends. It's a great lesson for Bing and for other children.

What We Need & What Are the Perks

Bing vs. the J-Crew  is completely written, illustrated, and designed. Your financial support will be used to obtain a final professional edit and print the first 250 copies in the United States.

Bing vs. the J-Crew Printed Copy
128 pages, Hardbound, 5.75 in. x 7.5 in.
Bing vs. the J-Crew has great illustrations throughout.


The Impact

My goal is to write books that engage children and build their love for reading at an early age. When I visit elementary classes, the students are excited to see themselves in my books and to talk about their dreams for their futures. I also provide them with books to take home. I want to continue promoting literacy by creating great books for early readers.

If this project is a success, I won't be mad at my son for putting bird feeders RIGHT OUTSIDE MY FRONT DOOR!


    Risks & Challenges

    I have several years of experience in publishing, however, I've learned something new with each book I published. I may encounter new unforeseen challenges, but I'll work hard to overcome them as I did in the past. I will keep you up-to-date on the project and strive to get your book(s) delivered on time in August.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute financially, there are other equally important ways you can help:

    • Please email, text, or tweet this page to your circle of friends by using the Indiegogo share tools! The use of smoke signals or even carrier pigeons are not frowned upon.

story:
#SetBrooklenFREE Campaign

Summary of the project

My novel, Love Incorruptible: A Woman’s Reflective Journey to Freedom will help its readers connect the dots of their lifelong pain and hopefully consider joining the journey to personal freedom. This story takes the reader on a transparent ride through the main character, Brooklen Sapphire’s rocky upbringing, risky behavior, emotional abuse and so much more. The final straw of infidelity in her marriage prompts her to take a long, hard look in the mirror in order to break free of all the things holding her back from life’s best treasures – forgiveness, freedom and love. Brooklen’s narrative will show readers the connection between our imperfect childhoods and adult complexities. If you’re willing to roll up your sleeves and get dirty, then this story can ignite your very own love incorruptible – a journey that will teach you love in the most everlasting way.

My goal is to connect to the pain of my audience and lead them on a journey towards healing and self love. I don’t want anyone to think for a second that you have to be picture perfect to be used by God. We see some of the most incredible stories come from the people that have been tragically broken. You can experience darkness and still be worthy of the light. Again, the goal with releasing Love Incorruptible is to reach the people that are open to learning how facing into your pain can be liberating and most of all, used for a good purpose. Everything great begins with an inspiration. I believe this story will inspire others out of fear and into purpose.

About the Author

Jazmin Steele is a mother, women's empowerment and self-care advocate. She earned a bachelor degree in Business and has launched several companies as an entrepreneur. Jazmin's background in journalism and blogging opens creative doors to spread her message of hope, overcoming trauma and learning self love. She has extended her art into children's books and photography. Her greatest joy is serving as a mentor and mother to her three daughters.

Reason for funding project

After researching and consulting with my team, we decided that partnering with Indiegogo to crowd fund the project was a great fit. Crowdfunding gives others an opportunity to be apart of a mission that empowers women to become healed and love themselves. I believe that the main character, Brooklen’s story will ignite a spark of layered conversations in women’s groups, training rooms, bookstores and on electronic devices everywhere.

** Fun fact! We will be publishing our little future Best Selling Novel through online self-publishing book and e-book company, Lulu.com.

We need to raise $5,498. Here are the details:

  • Publishing - $1999 (includes final book design, copyediting, formatting for print & digital conversion, and book printing)
  • Marketing and PR - $3499 (includes website development, video production - including time, talent & technology, social media marketing and public relations expenses)
  • Indiegogo processing fees

What do you get?

To say Thank You, I have some really sweet perks for your support. They include:

  • Supporters Vote #SetBrooklenFree T-Shirt
  • Ten downloadable designs & social media memes of original quotes by Author
  • A Skype Q&A call with the Author, you & your friends
  • An autographed copy of Love Incorruptible (personal message included)
  • VIP invitation to launch party
  • Name listed as Supporter on my website
  • And more to come!

Together, we can spread this message of hope. I have faith in us.

Other ways you can help

I am the first to understand that money can be tight sometimes, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Feel free to do any or all of the following. Either way, I’m sure you’ll make an impact.

  • Sign up for my launch newsletter at eepurl.com/cTj8m1
  • Share the campaign with your social network & ask your friends to join you
  • Follow me on Instagram and Facebook on your social media pages
  • Leave a review on Amazon.com after you read my book (link coming soon)

story:
Lets Get Transgender Boys Childerns Books Into Our World!

Hi Everyone, I'm Tiffany. I've put "Ryder's Journey: Being Who HE Truly Is" together after finding absolutely nothing on the internet or in stores about a transgender boy growing up. It's 2019 and it blows my mind that there aren't any books out there for our children growing up today. So I decided I was going to change this; thus, Ryder was born. I wrote about his journey from the day he was born until the time he begins kindergarten.

Supporting Ryder and sharing his story with your kids, family and friends will directly help LGBTQ+ youth who have been rejected by their families and loved ones. Your support represents you agreeing that every kid deserves to be able to pick up a children's book at a young age and find a character that they can relate to. Together we are teaching our family members, friends, communities, and schools that we are all born with one unique soul from the very beginning.

Raising money for "Ryder's Journey" will help tour this book. You will also allow "Ryder's Journey" to be published in hardcopy, making it easier to get into our libraries. You will be making it possible to continue his story as he starts kindergarten and continues his walk through life.

Raising $10,000

Where's this all going?

* To self publish "Ryder's Journey" in hardcopy (most libraries will only accept hardcopy books)

* Fund a US tour of "Ryder's Journey" in which the book would be exhibited at bookstores, libraries, and community centers nationwide. The tour would give the book the publicity it deserves and would offer support to any LGBTQ+ youth in audiences. 

* Help me self publish Ryder's next journey in his life, going to kindergarten. I would love to explore Ryder's path as he gets older and begins his pre-teen to teenage years. These books would share the obstacles that cross his path and how he and those around him deal with them. 

Why Is "Ryder's Journey" So Important?

"Ryder's Journey" is a book for a little transgender boy who is trying to figure himself out. It would give them a character they can relate to. It would reassure transgender boys who hear everyone calling them a girl, but everything inside their body, heart and soul tells them, "No, I'm not a girl at all! I'm a boy, I real boy!" that this is a totally okay feeling to feel.

This book is also for kids who are cisgender (people who identify with the body they were born in), and would help them learn acceptance for friends or family members that are transgender. "Ryder's Journey" will educate these kids and their parents on what it means to be transgender.

We know who we are from day one, but need to learn how to communicate our identify. By 3-4 years old, kids develop these skills and can verbalize who they are. However, when these kids see rows of "girl" and "boy" toys and are told they may only enjoy specific things, they begin to question whether they even want to continue living. Transgender kids as young as 6 are attempting to commit suicide - this is heartbreaking and must be stopped.

There must be more diversity in children's books for our young kids. Every child should have a book that they can relate to growing up. I want to be a part of that change and help kids grow up in an environment where they feel safe being their authentic self.

Risks & Challenges

There will always be those who think a transgender child's book is wrong, against what they believe in, or something children should not be reading.

I believe these people are the ones hiding from their true selves. There are many reasons why they might think this way, ranging from their upbringing to their development in life. These families commonly neglect their children's interests in favor for their own vision of what encompasses a "good life."

I feel bad for these kinds of people. I cannot imagine the fear they must feel, knowing they can never express their true selves or break our societal norms. I cannot imagine what it must feel like to have everything you know built around these constructs and myths.

It's 2019 and time for change. We don't live in the 50's or 60's and must constantly evolve to accept those around us. Those reluctant to change must learn to educate themselves for the benefit of their children and their community.

For those of you who don't understand what it means to be transgender, I implore you to read "Ryder's Journey: Being Who HE Truly Is" because it will educate you and help you understand what being transgender really means. Look outside your box, step out of your comfort zone (just a little) and check it out. What you find may surprise you.

*Please Share & Spread the Word!*

PLEASE share this link on all of your social media. Tell your friends and family about "Ryder's Journey"! Tell all of your people to tell their people!! Let's get this book out into the world and into the hands of children and adults alike.

**USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS**

story:
Short Summary

  • Talyne Corlyn - Author, Publisher, Singer, Songwriter, Community Volunteer. Former owner of Meadow Lakes Publishing Company and publisher of a small local news magazine called Meadow Lakes Press.  Strong background in working with the public as an instructor, performer, life coach, on-air personality, mentor and recreational program director.
  • Steve Belka - Musician and Storyteller. Former owner Love of Alaska Remodeling and Construction Company. Strong background in building and design, equipment maintenance, basic bookkeeping skills.
  • Our campaign is to restart the company under the name Verde River Publishing after the other business had to close due to illness. It's a way for us to start our life over after dialysis, two organ transplants and Steve surviving cancer. We've worked very hard to be strong enough to make it through those challenges so that we could work again.
  • This company will not only help us but others who have faced adversity and survived stronger! By publishing their stories we can possibly inspire and motivate others to help themselves or their fellow citizens. We'll launch the Women's Voices Project in the spring, enlisting women from all walks of life to share their writing.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We seek funds in the amount of $32,000 to purchase wire and perfect (paperbacks) binding and printing equipment, new computer  and software for publishing, paper, cover paper and office supplies, start-up costs for incorporation, state and local licenses and taxes, insurance, communication, stipend, a merchant account for accepting credit cards, and marketing. A complete breakdown of the costs is available in the full business plan and backers can contact me for a copy.
  • This company is not only a business venture, it is an investment in community and bridge building. By relaying our stories we hope to enrich and motivate, uplift and spark laughter. More companies are adopting this business model and finding it can be profitable. The journals we featured were extremely popular with our old company. They are unique and can be designed specifically for the user. The photography and art we use is captivating, much of the photography from Alaska. Our fiction stories are intriguing, bringing exciting new storylines to the page. We have a number of stories featuring LGBTQ themes explored in a slightly different way. Hurry Up and Wait and Catching Serendipity are two books that are out of print because we sold every copy before the illnesses. Two very good books waiting to be republished in updated 2nd Editions
  • In the event that our target funding goal is not met, we will put what we do raise into equipment first. We will adjust by designing a smaller shop, find refurbished equipment instead of purchasing new, or lease it, and by shaving some off of the larger marketing ideas.

The Impact

  • Negative information and stories in the news have increased dramatically in the last 20 – 30 years.  This almost constant barrage of negativity can cause stress, which, in turn can lead to low productivity due to an individuals personal reaction to that negativity.  These societal ills have a detrimental effect on the community at large, which in turn affect local business. We all win when the community is stronger. Though we realize that sheltering ourselves from bad news is impossible, it is our mission to be a leader in the positive news arena and believe that this business model will assist in helping the company grow. We are witnessing resurgence in the millennium old passion for stories and storytelling. Not just as a recreational art form, indeed, some see a need to relay what is happening to them, their family, neighbor and friends. Many voices are longing to be heard and sadly, many of them have no way to accomplish this. By giving them a voice we build confidence and confidence, coupled with compassion, builds strong communities.
  • I published a local good news magazine, which won 1st Place - Personal Achievement category in the 2007 Alaska Professional Communicators Contest. Written articles and designed recreation curriculum acknowledged by our then governor, Steve Cowper, twice. I was a columnist and reporter for The Frontiersman Newspaper in The Matanuska Susitna Borough, Alaska. The first three books I published myself received great reviews and all printed copies are sold out.
  • This has been a dream and goal I set for myself while I was on the transplant list. Our retirement was wiped out due to the medical situations in our lives and we are determined to rewrite current history to what we want it to read. We are giving all we have to this and are all in.

Risks & Challenges

  • Because we have dealt with so much adversity, the type that sends people into despair, we certainly possess the knowledge and determination to enter this with certitude. The greatest failure is to give up and not try at all.  Having said that, the challenge will be to get the trust of the community to purchase advertising in our magazine and retailers willing to carry our inventory. In today's publishing market retailers are inundated with cartons of books and publications. The goal is to stand out from all the rest.
  • It is our intention to connect with the community by partnering with businesses, agencies and organizations that are hosting events. Getting retailers to review and carry the inventory will take personal and ongoing communication with each retailer, offering unique storylines and attractive, captivating covers. We plan to do a great deal of personal events for further exposure. personal connection is the way that almost 2/3rds of buyers today purchase products.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about the campaign with us!
story_txt:
Short Summary

Talyne Corlyn - Author, Publisher, Singer, Songwriter, Community Volunteer. Former owner of Meadow Lakes Publishing Company and publisher of a small local news magazine called Meadow Lakes Press.  Strong background in working with the public as an instructor, performer, life coach, on-air personality, mentor and recreational program director.
Steve Belka - Musician and Storyteller. Former owner Love of Alaska Remodeling and Construction Company. Strong background in building and design, equipment maintenance, basic bookkeeping skills.
Our campaign is to restart the company under the name Verde River Publishing after the other business had to close due to illness. It's a way for us to start our life over after dialysis, two organ transplants and Steve surviving cancer. We've worked very hard to be strong enough to make it through those challenges so that we could work again.
This company will not only help us but others who have faced adversity and survived stronger! By publishing their stories we can possibly inspire and motivate others to help themselves or their fellow citizens. We'll launch the Women's Voices Project in the spring, enlisting women from all walks of life to share their writing.


What We Need & What You Get

We seek funds in the amount of $32,000 to purchase wire and perfect (paperbacks) binding and printing equipment, new computer  and software for publishing, paper, cover paper and office supplies, start-up costs for incorporation, state and local licenses and taxes, insurance, communication, stipend, a merchant account for accepting credit cards, and marketing. A complete breakdown of the costs is available in the full business plan and backers can contact me for a copy.
This company is not only a business venture, it is an investment in community and bridge building. By relaying our stories we hope to enrich and motivate, uplift and spark laughter. More companies are adopting this business model and finding it can be profitable. The journals we featured were extremely popular with our old company. They are unique and can be designed specifically for the user. The photography and art we use is captivating, much of the photography from Alaska. Our fiction stories are intriguing, bringing exciting new storylines to the page. We have a number of stories featuring LGBTQ themes explored in a slightly different way. Hurry Up and Wait and Catching Serendipity are two books that are out of print because we sold every copy before the illnesses. Two very good books waiting to be republished in updated 2nd Editions
In the event that our target funding goal is not met, we will put what we do raise into equipment first. We will adjust by designing a smaller shop, find refurbished equipment instead of purchasing new, or lease it, and by shaving some off of the larger marketing ideas.


The Impact

Negative information and stories in the news have increased dramatically in the last 20 – 30 years.  This almost constant barrage of negativity can cause stress, which, in turn can lead to low productivity due to an individuals personal reaction to that negativity.  These societal ills have a detrimental effect on the community at large, which in turn affect local business. We all win when the community is stronger. Though we realize that sheltering ourselves from bad news is impossible, it is our mission to be a leader in the positive news arena and believe that this business model will assist in helping the company grow. We are witnessing resurgence in the millennium old passion for stories and storytelling. Not just as a recreational art form, indeed, some see a need to relay what is happening to them, their family, neighbor and friends. Many voices are longing to be heard and sadly, many of them have no way to accomplish this. By giving them a voice we build confidence and confidence, coupled with compassion, builds strong communities.
I published a local good news magazine, which won 1st Place - Personal Achievement category in the 2007 Alaska Professional Communicators Contest. Written articles and designed recreation curriculum acknowledged by our then governor, Steve Cowper, twice. I was a columnist and reporter for The Frontiersman Newspaper in The Matanuska Susitna Borough, Alaska. The first three books I published myself received great reviews and all printed copies are sold out.
This has been a dream and goal I set for myself while I was on the transplant list. Our retirement was wiped out due to the medical situations in our lives and we are determined to rewrite current history to what we want it to read. We are giving all we have to this and are all in.


Risks & Challenges

Because we have dealt with so much adversity, the type that sends people into despair, we certainly possess the knowledge and determination to enter this with certitude. The greatest failure is to give up and not try at all.  Having said that, the challenge will be to get the trust of the community to purchase advertising in our magazine and retailers willing to carry our inventory. In today's publishing market retailers are inundated with cartons of books and publications. The goal is to stand out from all the rest.
It is our intention to connect with the community by partnering with businesses, agencies and organizations that are hosting events. Getting retailers to review and carry the inventory will take personal and ongoing communication with each retailer, offering unique storylines and attractive, captivating covers. We plan to do a great deal of personal events for further exposure. personal connection is the way that almost 2/3rds of buyers today purchase products.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Help us get the word out and make some noise about the campaign with us!

story:
Rural journalism is more important than ever. We need your help. 

In an environment of untrustworthy news sources, urban newspapers that don't have the resources to cover rural areas, and a fast growing population, Banks and the surrounding communities need a local news source more than ever. We plan to cover news in all the communities up to the edge of the Columbia County line.

This campaign will help cover initial startup costs for the Banks Post. Running a news source is no easy or inexpensive task. A list of costs that is by no means complete includes the following: 

  • Startup business and legal costs
  • Freedom of Information Act requests (FOIA)
  • Camera equipment
  • Website and related fees
  • Travel expenses (the area we cover is more than 100 square miles!)
  • Event fees
  • Printing supplies
  • So much more.

With your generous donations, we will be able to hit the ground running in early 2017! 

About the editor
Chas Hundley, editor of the Banks Post, grew up just a few miles outside of Banks in Gales Creek, Oregon. From a young age, he was active in the community, but after Gales Creek suffered a severe economic downturn, Chas turned to journalism to try to inform the community of local news and happenings in and around Gales Creek, with what has become the Gales Creek Journal, an online-only news source for Gales Creek, Glenwood, and Timber.  In addition to the Journal, Chas' work has been published in the Tillamook County Pioneer, the Forest Grove Leader, and other local publications. He wants to bring the same style of local journalism to the Banks area, where he earned his Eagle Scout rank in the local Boy Scout troop 581. 

Other ways to help:

Please, please, please share this campaign with your friends and family in the Banks area! 

You can also follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and sign up for email alerts on our website.

story:
Bring a catchy story and song to your family's
Thanksgiving traditions!
 

"Turducken" is not quite "The Night Before Christmas," but it *is* a fun story for family members to read and sing along to as the kids are waiting for their holiday meal!  :)



Hi!  I'm Ms. Kat!  I lead preschool Music & Movement classes in Austin, Texas.  I've worked with Mothers Day Out program groups, lead elective enrichment classes in private full-time daycare facilities, and host public caregiver-and-child format classes in the Austin Parks and Recreation Department's activity centers.  I've performed concerts for charity events, community festivals, and local businesses dedicated to keeping Austin "The Live Music Capital of the World."
  

My mission is to introduce the fundamentals of melody, rhythm, tempo, and dynamics to all enthusiastic and wiggly little music-lovers.  I encourage free expression and inclusion of all learning styles; reflective learners, kinetic learners, neurotypical learners, and those with special needs.  Classes are free of any performance pressure, and we embrace creativity and input from our classmates.  There is no wrong way to learn, love, and appreciate music!

Kids are an endless source of inspiration.  So often I come away from our interactions with an idea for a song, based on my students' unique (and often silly) perspectives on the world.  Over the years, I've written a number of original songs for children, but due to our class format, rarely have occasion to share them.

"Turducken" is a song I wrote a few years ago while planning my monthly curriculum, when I realized how few Thanksgiving songs exist.  "Turkey In the Straw" was one of the only songs I could readily play on an inherited mountain dulcimer I was bringing along to show the children, so it was a simple feat to write the song as a parody. Later, I began sketching barnyard poultry with the intention of bringing illustrations along to classes as visual aids -- and the idea to publish the song as a *book* was born! 

Your contribution to this campaign will offset the expenses incurred in the process of producing, publishing, marketing, and distributing physical copies of this storybook and recording.  While self-publishing has become much more attainable in recent years, adding the mixed-media aspect of illustrations and a song adds a new dimension of difficulty -- and expense.  (And the song is the whole point!)

A successful launch of "Turducken" will encourage me to continue with an entire series of holiday publications, including "No Snow Down South," "Spooky, Spooky, Skeleton," "Ask the Groundhog," and more, followed by a camping compilation aimed at the lucky kids whose parents bring them along to music festival tent cities! 


 

Why I need your help:

  • Short answer: Music is notoriously not a lucrative business.  On top of that well-known fact, Ms. Kat's Music & Movement, LLC offers music classes for less than *half* the cost of similar preschool enrichment programs.  It is extremely important to me to keep music education affordable and accessible to more families....  However, low margins don't leave much wiggle room for growth or new ventures.
     
  • Print-On-Demand book publishing is pricey!  Creating physical copies of books just for the folks who already *know* they want them costs more for you, and doesn't help me pay to advertise, market, and distribute the books to a wider audience.  The more funding we raise, and the more books I can order up front, the more substantial the discount!
     
  • A successfully funded campaign will provide some extra books that I can distribute as free review copies to publishing houses, bookstores, libraries, schools, and childcare centers.
     
  • Perks include "thank you" PDF coloring pages, books, or book-and-cd combos, and I'm happy to sign copies of books and CDs before I mail them out (or deliver them, locally).
     
  • 10% of any profit beyond the expenses of this first run of printing, marketing, and distribution will be donated to Austin's Capital Area Food Bank.  Charitable gifts are an offer I hope to honor with every publication.
     
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, I will simply print as many copies as I can afford!  You can get a book and a FREE warm fuzzy feeling!

     

A Drop in the Bucket-List

"Write A Book" seems to be on the to-do list for lots of folks.  I find myself in the unique position that I can make it so.  I have the story.  I have the illustrations.  I have a ready-made audience who will appreciate it right away!

In just 10 weeks in 2011, I raised nearly $10,000 in donations for the St. Baldrick's Foundation for children's cancer research, and learned how generous and kind people could be.  That little drops add up to a big bucket quickly.  That sometimes when you simply ask, the answer is "yes."  It has taken some time to work up the courage to ask for your support for a personal project!

  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funding to my campaign, that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Please LIKE, and SHARE, and RETWEET Ms. Kat's Music's postings about "Turducken."
  • Watch the video on YouTube.  SHARE the video with your friends, family, and preschool classmates and teachers!
  • Please SHARE this IndieGoGo campaign.  (Maybe it will make it to the inbox of a big Turducken fan, like John Madden, or Paula Deen, or a member of the Prudhomme family?)  
  • Sing the "Turducken" song while preparing your holiday meal.  When you forget the words, shake your fist in the air and wish aloud that you had a copy of the lyrics... perhaps an illustrated, bound copy!  And then make it so!!!


Thank you so much for sticking around to read all of this.  I promise, the book is just a fraction as long.  Happy Thanksgiving!  Meow, meow!  :)

story:
My name is Felicia and I am the author of the illustrated story "Furever Lucky".

Creating entertaining and compelling stories for children as my life's work was always one of my dream.  A year ago, I turned to writing a children's book  inspired by my very best animal friend, my dog, Lucky.

My early years were spent somewhere between reading, travelling in Europe, studying engineering and learning foreign languages.

Later raising children and baking cookies was more of the usual routine.

I am born and raised in the magical land of Romania but now live in Canada.

I was fascinated by how Lucky learned everything new and how he perceived the world. First afraid and then fully embracing the experience.

This book is very important to me because I had so much fun writing it and I made me feel alive. Also  I want to share with children and the people who want to get a dog , some of the situations and challenges they may expect.

This campaign is intended to help me finance publishing my book with Archway Publishing , a division of Simon and Schuster.

Today I am here to tell you how we can bring this project to life. I have chose Arcwhay Publishing a division of Simon and Schuster to publish my book, powered by experts.The Inspire Package allows me to use illustrations to bring life to my children's book. With the Inspire Package, I will be able to put my hard work into the hands of children.

The package that I choose is the following

http://www.archwaypublishing.com/PublishingPackages/Childrens/Inspire/

and it has a lot of features , allowing me to work with the best experts in the book industries. 

For every donation up to 25 USD dollars you will get a thank you card with Lucky paw’s print. 10 % of every donation will go to Animatch , a non profit dog adoption Service.

For every donation between 26 to 75 USD dollars you will get an electronic copy of my book and a personal thank you card with Lucky paw’s print. 10 % of every donation will go to Animatch , a non profit dog adoption Service.

For every donation of 76 USD and over you will get a signed soft copy of my book and a personal thank you card. 10 % of every donation will go to Animatch , a non profit dog adoption Service.  (http://animatch.ca/)

The money raised will go entirely for financing the book.

Every book is a new window to the World and I hope you will find it as funny and as entertaining as I had writing it.

Your contribution will make a big difference for me as the printing costing are high. This package will give me access to a  good marketing plan , a Worldwide Book Distribution (38.000 Retailers worldwide) and the book will be included in a digital  Bookseller Catalog powered by  Edelweiss . That means that my book will be listed in a comprehensive online database that includes titles from top publishers, such as Simon & Schuster, Random House, Penguin Group, HarperCollins and more.

I do want to thank you for reading this and hopefully contributing to this dear project of mine. I am very excited about publishing my first book and I hope that you will become part of this journey.

If you cannot help me financially but have some friends or relatives that would love to get involved , please spread the word and send them this link.

God bless you, Thanks again !
