story:
Overview

Hello there, I'm the person behind Milk the Cow podcast. A platform for discussion and issue-based work in both audio and written formats. Across social media, there are circa 80,000 people who kindly follow my work.

 

I feel now more than ever that a book as an educational resource on the true history of British colonialism (and it's contemporary impact) is needed. What is colonialism and its intersections and impacts in our society? How has and will the Black Lives Matter movement change our world? Who is the real Winston Churchill? How does football act as a vehicle for the left and right-wing of politics, of prejudice, and solidarity? What are the potential solutions to all of this and how can we bring people together? 

 

As a white man, I feel compelled to use my voice, privilege, and platform to make a contribution to positive change by amplifying BAME voices, who will be centered in this work. I would like to thank my BAME friends both on and offline for encouraging me to put this project together. I am also a product of colonialism, my ancestry is Irish, so an element of this project is intensely personal and I hope revelatory as I confront myself and maybe my own prejudices via this process of shared discovery.

 

On a personal note, I have a chance that may not present itself again in my life. To make a transition from part-time amateur to full time professional. The book is a culmination of over 10 years of writing published via the ever-growing Milk the Cow community - all available for free.

 

If my work has ever impacted you in a positive way, why not invest in me via a one-off contribution? 

 

What do I want to do with the money?

 

As well as supporting the production of the book, I want to use this experience as a catalyst for wider professional development.  By the end of this year, I want it to be very apparent to you good people just how far your kindness has impacted my ability to produce much more professional looking content.

 

The initial £5000 will go towards living costs between June 2020 and March 2021. This amount will mean my rent and some bills are covered and that stress levels at home are manageable. This will enable me to live frugally but focus fully on producing the book without any anxiety.

 

Any stretch targets that occur will go towards:

 

A new website to host all of my content.  

 

Better camera equipment, editing software, and microphones enabling me to share the interviews with people on this journey as video podcasts. I have only produced audio to date.

 

Travel and accommodation to go where people are to make the book and podcasts as good as they can be. Face to face.

 

An Editor and sound technician. 

 

Taking this on the road, a book tour, a course and workshops designed and developed. This can be taken into schools, youth projects, and anywhere there is an audience for this work.

 

A Proofreader.

 

Your kind support will help to set me up for the next 10 years and beyond:

 

I haven't had a traditional route available to me via university etc, your support will give me the opportunity to reach my full potential as a writer whilst also utilising my skills and experiences in the community, to bring this vital knowledge to ears which need to hear it and eyes which need to see it.

 

For 10 years I've been slowly building a following for my various forms of content.  With your support, this will give me the opportunity to take things to the next level.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

To date, I haven't completed a 'large' project like writing a book. I have started projects but sadly the need to get out there and make money in other areas to pay for my basic necessities has got in the way. Due to Covid-19 my diary is currently clear. This is a real opportunity to 'clear the decks' and focus my attention on completing this much-needed project. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please do share the campaign on social media and Milk the Cow Podcast in your post.  Maybe you have a special skill that you feel can help this project?

 

Anything you can do to support this project and make it manifest into the world i am very grateful. Thank you for reading.
story_txt:
Overview
Hello there, I'm the person behind Milk the Cow podcast. A platform for discussion and issue-based work in both audio and written formats. Across social media, there are circa 80,000 people who kindly follow my work.
 
I feel now more than ever that a book as an educational resource on the true history of British colonialism (and it's contemporary impact) is needed. What is colonialism and its intersections and impacts in our society? How has and will the Black Lives Matter movement change our world? Who is the real Winston Churchill? How does football act as a vehicle for the left and right-wing of politics, of prejudice, and solidarity? What are the potential solutions to all of this and how can we bring people together? 
 
As a white man, I feel compelled to use my voice, privilege, and platform to make a contribution to positive change by amplifying BAME voices, who will be centered in this work. I would like to thank my BAME friends both on and offline for encouraging me to put this project together. I am also a product of colonialism, my ancestry is Irish, so an element of this project is intensely personal and I hope revelatory as I confront myself and maybe my own prejudices via this process of shared discovery.
 
On a personal note, I have a chance that may not present itself again in my life. To make a transition from part-time amateur to full time professional. The book is a culmination of over 10 years of writing published via the ever-growing Milk the Cow community - all available for free.
 
If my work has ever impacted you in a positive way, why not invest in me via a one-off contribution? 
 
What do I want to do with the money?
 
As well as supporting the production of the book, I want to use this experience as a catalyst for wider professional development.  By the end of this year, I want it to be very apparent to you good people just how far your kindness has impacted my ability to produce much more professional looking content.

A new website to host all of my content.

Travel and accommodation to go where people are to make the book and podcasts as good as they can be. Face to face.
 
An Editor and sound technician. 
 
Taking this on the road, a book tour, a course and workshops designed and developed. This can be taken into schools, youth projects, and anywhere there is an audience for this work.
 
A Proofreader.
 
Your kind support will help to set me up for the next 10 years and beyond:
 
I haven't had a traditional route available to me via university etc, your support will give me the opportunity to reach my full potential as a writer whilst also utilising my skills and experiences in the community, to bring this vital knowledge to ears which need to hear it and eyes which need to see it.
 
For 10 years I've been slowly building a following for my various forms of content.  With your support, this will give me the opportunity to take things to the next level.
 
Risks & Challenges
 
To date, I haven't completed a 'large' project like writing a book. I have started projects but sadly the need to get out there and make money in other areas to pay for my basic necessities has got in the way. Due to Covid-19 my diary is currently clear. This is a real opportunity to 'clear the decks' and focus my attention on completing this much-needed project.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Toni Mitchell and I have been in the media industry for nearly 20 years.
  • I have created a crowdfunding campaign to raise money to start my own digital media/entertainment company.
  • Your donation is essential to the success of my ambitious endeavor. The funds raised will help me hire staff, so that we can produces quality and entertaining news and original scripted and non scripted content that is short and to the point.  
  • I call it "infotainment" on the go.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I have a very ambitious goal of raising $100,000. There's a saying: "If you shoot for the stars, you will fall among the clouds." So yes, I'm aiming high and with your help, I know I can reach my goal.
  • The money will be for three things: 1. Hire staff, particularly anchor, TV host, videographer/editor  2. Rent space to shoot videos/any needed equipment like lights and microphones. 3. Advertising/marketing. It's hard to make money if you don't spend money.
  • If I don't reach the goal of $100,000, whatever funds that I do raise, will go toward hiring freelance staff to create the content. Right now, I do everything myself. But, in order for it to be at a high quality, I need professional people who specialize in video editing and I need an anchor to host the news and the other original show I have planned.

The Impact

  • There is a ton of content online. Sometimes it's information overload. But, what stands out about Express News&Views is that one, it's quick, so you won't waste a lot of time on what you read or see. Next, I am a visionary who constantly thinks in a creative and outside of the box sort of way. So, the original content that I have in store will  be unique and something I have not seen online.
  • I have worked in the media industry for 20 years. I have been a TV producer/scriptwriter, managing editor, newspaper reporter and multi-media journalist, so I have a great sense of what people want to see. I also have the necessary experience in management and business to be successful.
  • You are the only one who can make Express News&Views a reality. Without your help, the dream of a unique online media platform that is new and refreshing, becomes a lot harder to reach.

Risks & Challenges

  • Owning a media company isn't going to be easy. I have worked for two CEOs who started digital media start-ups and both of them had tremendous struggles and hurdles. One thing that I noticed about both of those individuals is that neither had actually worked in the media/entertainment industry. I have 20 years experience in the business and I think that will be a huge advantage for me because I know what I'm talking about. And what I don't know, I am willing to listen to others to make this company viable.
  • One thing I learned from working at those two previous digital startups is that I have to crawl before I walk. I don't want to be a Netflix right out of the gate. That is not a reasonable goal. I just want to start out small and steadily grow. Secondly, I know that getting sponsors and ads will be crucial. This is where my background in sales will be key. Talking with businesses and getting them to advertise on my site. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I know that not everyone can donate, but if you could please let others know about my crowdfunding campaign, I would really appreciate it. You can also like my website which would also help grow my viewers which is something I need as well. Please go to: https://expressnews.home.blog/ and like my page. You can also like Express News&Views on FB at: https://www.facebook.com/ViewItNow/
  • Also, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Now shipping in HARDCOVER, not paperback!

After getting a better idea of my publishing options I discovered that it was possible to get hardcover books printed at a reasonable price, so that is exactly what I'm doing.  I want to make sure that I'm giving you, my backers, the highest-quality product possible for your money.  I can't change the perk descriptions, but any purchase of a "paperback novel" during this campaign will get you a hardcover book instead.  I will also be sending out an epub file along with the PDFs to allow for more electronic reading options.  Thanks for your interest!

A gripping debut novel from a serving soldier!

THE MAIDEN'S WAR is an epic war novel informed by my years of service in the United States Army.  Set in an industrializing fantasy world where magic has almost, but not entirely died out, it tells the story of the latest campaign of the Thousand Years' War of the Empire of Masks against the Western Kingdom - a war that, not too long ago, the Kingdom seemed to have won.  Rising like a phoenix after decades of brutal insurgency broke the Royal occupation, the Empire is more powerful than ever and hell-bent on vengeance.

Now the Imperial Army has stormed across the Night River, destroying the Kingdom's mightiest fortress in a matter of hours and opening the door for a massive invasion.  The Royal Army mobilizes for a counteroffensive, but can they possibly succeed?

Our Heroes

Sophia Rose is a young soldier in Charlie Company, 2nd Battalion of the Royal Army's 24th Infantry Regiment, a reserve unit from the idyllic town Jade Falls.  Most women in the Royal Army serve in support roles, or in the case of noble young ladies with a wild streak, in the light cavalry.  It's almost unheard-of to see a girl in the infantry, but in the reserves, when your father's the First Sergeant, well... there's actually nothing in the regulations against it.  She joined the Army to spend time with her father and her friends, and she'll be marching with them into the inferno of war.

Arilin Wehrherz is a princess, second in line to the Kingdom's throne.  After saying goodbye to her beloved older brother as he departed for the front with his regiment she asks her father to let her accompany the Army herself despite her young age.  She'll need to learn about war to properly fulfill her duties as a princess, after all.  Her father agreed on the conditions that she'd find a capable chaperone and stay well out of any danger, and he probably didn't expect her to go out and do exactly that.  War is full of surprises, though, and her little adventure might turn out to be a lot more dangerous - and important - than she bargained for.

Patricia MacMahon is the first female two-star general in the Royal Army's history (and one of the youngest), and her career is dead.  Stuck pushing paper at headquarters after being promoted out of responsibility, she seizes on Princess Arilin's crazy request as a way to maybe, somehow, revitalize her career.  At a minimum it'll be a lot more entertaining than sitting around the half-empty War Ministry.  She doesn't have a ready ticket to the front herself, but she has someone in mind that should fit their needs quite nicely.

Walter Haas has been a general for longer than Patricia has been an officer, and he's been fighting the Empire since before she was born.  Commander of the Royal Army's IX Corps, he was staring mandatory retirement in the face when the Empire attacked and threw him into one last war.  IX Corps will be far to the rear as the Royal Army's counterattack begins, an ideal place for a young princess to learn about war without being exposed to any real danger, and he's not against having a couple of pretty girls around headquarters to improve the atmosphere.  Patricia's far from the worst officer he knows, either, and the Empire doesn't fight by half measures.  He might need all the help he can get.

June Anjanou, the "long-haired dragoon", is the son of the Imperial Western Area Army's supreme commander and the heir to a legacy as a Black Knight that goes back to the days of the Faceless King.  The only thing more dangerous than his sword are the soldiers under his command as he rides out with the Imperial cavalry to meet the Kingdom's counterattack.

Want to read a sample?

Check out the first three chapters here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XTSPlsSLGCLHLDyFliDvnO4vHQq31t3iboD_udgujKc/edit?usp=sharing

My Story

I am a nine-year veteran of the United States Army.  As an officer in the Field Artillery, I have served across the world, from Hawaii to Korea to Texas to Iraq to the Airborne here at Fort Bragg, North Carolina.  I led a self-propelled cannon platoon on the front line of democracy in Korea and commanded one of the companies making up the 1st Armored Division's headquarters, the two greatest honors of my life.  I am a veteran of the war against ISIS, a struggle which I firmly believe should be called the War of the False Caliph but which is properly known to the Army as Operation Inherent Resolve.

I dreamed up, outlined and finally wrote this book across all of that.  My test readers couldn't put it down, and one of them, a truly well-read man, made some comparisons with classics of literature that floored me.  Armed with dreams of literary success, I put together my query letter and flooded out requests to agents to represent me and get my work published.  My manuscript was excellent and as a servicemember who wrote it on active duty I thought I had a compelling story that would have literary agents fighting each other to be my voice in the industry.  You would think that a war novel full of dynamic and compelling female protagonists, written by an Army officer who has worked by, with and for women in the military, would be an ideal product to put on shelves in this day and age.

Apparently not.  My project was met with out-of-hand rejection from agents, or the silence of those who don't bother to reply to rejected queries.  Perhaps the story of a dutiful princess admiring her older brother and struggling to shoulder her responsibilities, or of a girl joining the Army to spend time - and fight - alongside her strong and loving father and her male friends, offended their sensibilities somehow and scared them off.

No matter.  I wrote this book to appeal to everyone - liberal and conservative, young and old, from grizzled veterans to complete civilians.  My rule when writing was "Twilight to Tom Clancy".  And after watching the success of other creators crowdfunding their projects I decided to take the chance (the staff officer in me would call it a calculated risk) and dive in myself.

Current Status of the Project

The book is done.  I have the proof copy from the printer in hand and can order new copies at will.  At this point I'm selling a finished book - there is no further work to be done beyond sending you your copy.

One note - The manuscript comes out to 199,542 words, about double the length of a "standard" novel.  For a large 6"x9" printed book size it comes out to 480 pages.  The bottom line is that this is a substantial novel - ideal for a summer read!

Thanks for your interest in THE MAIDEN'S WAR - tell your friends, and let me tell you a story!

story:
Who are we?

  • We are mucmara – the magazine for the spirited.
  • We call our magazine ‘muc mara’ because the word means ‘dolphin’ in old Irish and dolphins are depicted as nurturing, healing creatures as well as spiritual messengers.
  • We have been publishing free online magazines since February 2017.
  • To date, we have published 14 issues.
  • Up to now our work on the magazine has been completely free of charge and it has been a real labour of love.  We have fitted the work in around our day jobs.
  • Our magazine is only interested in features that challenge and enhance the mind, body and soul.
  • We pride ourselves on featuring beautiful pages and interesting, thought provoking articles – we do not get bogged down with a mass of advertising.

 

 

Is there a demand?

Yes.  We have done our market research and we know there is a growing demand for, and interest in, our magazine.

We know that the marketplace we wish to enter is not oversaturated and as such, there is room for us and our uniqueness: our minimal advertising, our colourful pages, our original artwork front covers, our wide ranging topics.

 

Our unique selling points & what makes us stand out from any competitors

 

 

 

Team members

Editorial team

Angie King - Editor

Sharon Walsh -  Features Editor & Graphic Designer

 

Other members

Steve Tiernan - Business & Distribution Manager

Mike Chinnery - Printing

story:
Short Summary

The End of Echoes is the book of my heart. It is the first novel I wrote because it tells a story I believe needs to be in the world. It takes the reader deep into the character's lives to allow them to walk alongside them in their tragedy and healing. It touches on many important subjects that impact people's lives such as domestic violence, mental health issues and alcoholism/addiction.

It also shows the importance of legacies we leave behind for our children as well as how the same event can impact people in such different ways.

 

Synopsis

 

Two families are forever linked by tragedy.

Ruby Dunkin is in an abusive marriage. Despite her efforts to protect her two sons, her husband’s cruelty knows no bounds and eventually everyone suffers at his hand. Their volatile situation ends in tragedy. Billy, Ruby’s eldest son, is torn away from everyone that he loves. His loss leaves him consumed by hatred, rage and self-loathing. He becomes the one person he hates most in this world—his father.

Chelsea Wyatt is a senior in high school when she goes missing after work one night, never to return home. Until that time, her parents, Tom and Kendra Wyatt, knew only of this type of loss from stories on the evening news. Crimes like this are unheard of in their quiet and safe Midwestern town. Her parents, brother and friends all try to make sense of the tragedy that now consumes their lives, forever altering their futures.

For over eighteen years, no one knows the connection between Ruby Dunkin and Chelsea Wyatt. A journey through time reveals the common thread stitching their heartbreak together. Yesterday echoes throughout each character's life as they decide how, and If, they will break the chains of the past.

Will they continue to leave a legacy of pain and loss for future generations? Will they break the cycles of abuse that have destroyed so many lives?

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

All funds from pre-orders help to bring the book to market, pay for advertising and order inventory to take to book festivals and signing events.

 

The Impact

 

This campaign will help me bring into the world a novel that I first wrote over thirteen years ago. One that is close to my heart and means the world to me. Bits & Pieces was my first published novel but The End of Echoes is the one that runs deepest.

 

Risks & Challenges

The novel is written, the designs are ready. Pre-orders help bring the whole thing to the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute. That's ok! I want to share some wonderful perks with you but if you can't help financially you can still be a part of the success I hope for. Sharing this campaign, passing the link along in an email or direct message to someone who might be interested, sharing on Facebook or Twitter has a huge impact and you have my eternal gratitude for doing so.

Short Summary
The End of Echoes is the book of my heart. It is the first novel I wrote because it tells a story I believe needs to be in the world. It takes the reader deep into the character's lives to allow them to walk alongside them in their tragedy and healing. It touches on many important subjects that impact people's lives such as domestic violence, mental health issues and alcoholism/addiction.
It also shows the importance of legacies we leave behind for our children as well as how the same event can impact people in such different ways.
 
Synopsis
 
Two families are forever linked by tragedy.
Ruby Dunkin is in an abusive marriage. Despite her efforts to protect her two sons, her husband’s cruelty knows no bounds and eventually everyone suffers at his hand. Their volatile situation ends in tragedy. Billy, Ruby’s eldest son, is torn away from everyone that he loves. His loss leaves him consumed by hatred, rage and self-loathing. He becomes the one person he hates most in this world—his father.
Chelsea Wyatt is a senior in high school when she goes missing after work one night, never to return home. Until that time, her parents, Tom and Kendra Wyatt, knew only of this type of loss from stories on the evening news. Crimes like this are unheard of in their quiet and safe Midwestern town. Her parents, brother and friends all try to make sense of the tragedy that now consumes their lives, forever altering their futures.
For over eighteen years, no one knows the connection between Ruby Dunkin and Chelsea Wyatt. A journey through time reveals the common thread stitching their heartbreak together. Yesterday echoes throughout each character's life as they decide how, and If, they will break the chains of the past.
Will they continue to leave a legacy of pain and loss for future generations? Will they break the cycles of abuse that have destroyed so many lives?
 

What I Need & What You Get
 
All funds from pre-orders help to bring the book to market, pay for advertising and order inventory to take to book festivals and signing events.
 

The Impact
 
This campaign will help me bring into the world a novel that I first wrote over thirteen years ago. One that is close to my heart and means the world to me. Bits & Pieces was my first published novel but The End of Echoes is the one that runs deepest.
 

Risks & Challenges
The novel is written, the designs are ready. Pre-orders help bring the whole thing to the world.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can contribute. That's ok! I want to share some wonderful perks with you but if you can't help financially you can still be a part of the success I hope for. Sharing this campaign, passing the link along in an email or direct message to someone who might be interested, sharing on Facebook or Twitter has a huge impact and you have my eternal gratitude for doing so.

story:
Short Summary

This new hardcover edition would be available only at live events where Cathal Entertainment appears and through this IndieGoGo only. The funds collected will allow us to print a (First Run) of this amazing book, for our conventions appearances next year. 

We have some great stretch goals and we are keeping the reward tiers sensible and fun for our backers. Please help CATHAL ENTERTAINMENT print its very 1st hardcover edition!

What We Need & What You Get

  • All funds collected will cover the cost of printing and creating rewards for backers.  
  • We have great stretch goals with awesome digital content. 
  • Should we not reach our goal - All Backers will receive rewards as promised.  

The Impact

This will be Cathal Entertainment's first hardcover edition. We are excited about the chance to create this product and it will set the stage for future editions. 

Risks & Challenges

1.  As with all printing projects, we are subject to the availability and production time of our chosen printer. 
2.  We have set a delivery date we feel will overcome any delays that may occur should they arise.

If we reach this goal. All backers will receive a digital copy of: "GHOULS OF WAR" a Grace Flynn Chronicles Anthology. 

If we reach this goal. All backers will receive a digital copy of: "WELSH WITCH" a Grace Flynn Chronicles Anthology. 

If we reach this goal. All backers will receive a digital copy of: "DEATH'S ODYSSEY" a Grace Flynn Chronicles Graphic Novel. 

 

MORE PERKS ADDED ONCE THE ABOVE GOAL IS UNLOCKED

story:
Book Summary

As full time travellers, my partner Chris and I headed off to Morocco in January of 2020, and expected this trip to be like many others.  We looked forward to riding camels in the desert, exploring the nooks and crannies of the country, and learning all that we could about the Moroccan culture in the 90 day visa period that we were given. However, our blissful travels soon turned into some sort of crazy apocalyptic nightmare as suddenly borders, highways, restaurants and shops closed down all around us.  We hadn't really been paying attention to the news, and well, to say that I was side swiped by fear would be a huge understatement.  

What the hell was going on?  

When news reached me of the borders to Canada closing as well, I knew that something really serious was happening.  Never in my 30 years of travelling had I seen anything like THIS happen.  

Soon my friends were sending me all sorts of conspiracy theories, including one that the internet may shut down.  Being so far away from my family, with no current hope of returning to Canada, I fell into the deepest pit of fear that I had ever known.  I was a foreigner in a foreign land and I had no idea if this country was equipped to deal with a disaster of this magnitude.  

Would there be enough food to feed everybody?  Would the Moroccan people take care of us? Or would they cast us aside like the foreigners that we were?  Would we really be able to ride this out here?  Is it safe to be in a country like this during a global emergency?  

The questions came fast and furious as I spun myself into a vortex of continual fear.  However, over time, the Moroccan people, without even trying, were able to teach me how to deal with my fear.  Primarily, they demonstrated how it is to live in the now, and they exhibited kindness and hospitality like I had never known before.  Through all of this, I was finally able to submit my controlling nature, and allow myself to be taken care of.  Moroccans are famous for their hospitality, and me and my partner got a first hand show to see just how legitimate this claim is. 

This book is a fully transparent tale that explores what my thoughts and emotions were like as we navigated this new crazy reality.  It is a travel story, a memoir, and possibly a self-help guide as I know that many people will find bits and pieces of my story that they will relate to.  

Reasons For Funding 

I am over halfway finished writing this book, and am looking for funding for the following reasons: 

#1. As full time travellers, it is sometimes difficult to find a place where we can stay in one place to complete large scale projects.  For something like this, it is imperative to be able to hunker down in one spot where I can focus completely on my writing.  Funds raised will help us to rent an apartment for a longer term to do this.

#2. Although I have submitted to publishers, I may not get a publishing contract.  These funds will ensure that I am able to self-publish if the need arises.  

Other Ways You Can Help

PATREON - My partner and I have a Patreon page set up.  One of the tiers offers our Patrons the chance to read this book as it is written.  I have 12 chapters posted to the platform now.  If you would like to join us and be a monthly subscriber, please head to www.patreon.com/artisticvoyages.

YOUTUBE - We have recently really gotten our YouTube channel going.  In it we share travel experiences, foodie adventures, our mural painting projects and much more.  Please subscribe and like our videos to help us to boost our channel!  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCa-Yjr1tnOYLgg...

NEWSLETTER - Publishers love long email subscriber lists!  If you are interested in following our travelling and art journey, please consider signing up for our newsletter by heading to www.artisticvoyages.com.  I send out 1-2 emails per month that highlight where we are in the world, what we are up to, and any other interesting things that come our way.  

Thank You!

story:
Story Behind the Book

One day on our way to church, my then 7-year-old daughter, Kyah, asked me, “Does God think boys are more important than girls, because all we ever learn about in church are boys?”

Her question ran through my head and my heart for several days. I could not shake the feeling that there was something I was supposed to do to answer her question. I began to search for books about women in the Bible, but I primarily found books related to princesses or that featured primarily Caucasian images. It was important to me to ensure these women of the Bible were portrayed accurately as female heroes, not as princesses, and that girls of all ethnicities would see themselves in the images.

Over the next few weeks, I began to teach Kyah stories from the Bible about girls who trusted God and did amazing things in their lives because of their faith. We called them SHEroes (girls who are heroes). I initially self-published the Old Testament edition and sold more than 1,000 copies on my own. My NEW book, which now includes Old and New Testament SHEroes, was recently picked up by Morgan James Publishing and will be shared with children around the world!

It is imperative that every child knows that God uses all people – boys, girls, men, and women of all ethnicities – to demonstrate His power and love here on earth – not just in history, but today!

We want to partner with YOU to get SHEroes of the Bible into households, churches and organizations around the world! You can change the trajectory of a child's life by sharing the powerful stories of these courageous, faith-filled women! SHEroes of the Bible is needed in every household, church and discipleship program across the globe. Through this book, young and old will be inspired to become the dynamic, strong leaders that God created them to be. With your help, we can shape a future generation.

We have many perk options that include book donations to nonprofits who are changing lives around the globe! Make sure to check out these incredible organizations further down on my campaign page.

Added bonus: When you purchase from this campaign, you will receive your books 6-8 months before it hits bookstores!

 

Author, Lauren L. Nelson

https://www.laurenlnelson.com/

 

What Makes This Book Unique?

This book is filled with heroic WOMEN from the Bible!

Many people have never heard of these dynamic world-changing SHEroes. The Bible is clear that God can make a hero out of anyone that chooses to trust God and push past their fear, no matter the cost. In this book, every woman portrayed is unique and demonstrates heroism differently. Some are warriors on a battlefield while others demonstrate fearless faith, sacrificial love and limitless compassion.

Each SHEro is ethnically and beautifully DIVERSE! 

Ethnic diversity is lacking in many children's books, but it is so important that all children see their beautiful selves represented in a positive light. 

Each story includes engaging and EMPOWERING discussion questions!

Through each discussion question, children are encouraged to not only engage in self-reflection but to act! SHEroes of the Bible challenges kids to personally engage with their family, friends and community by putting their faith into action.

 

What is Included in This Book?

This brilliantly illustrated children’s PAPERBACK book is approximately 140 pages and contains 20 stories of 26 women from the Bible who became SHEroes when they trusted God and were moved to action. As its name portrays, “SHEroes of the Bible” provides strong female role models who are relevant to past, present and future generations. Girls of all ages will be inspired to become the dynamic, strong women that God created them to be.

 

~ Devotion Questions ~

Each story includes 3 to 4 discussion questions. These questions will help children personally apply what they have learned so that their faith becomes their own personal experience. Through each discussion question, children are encouraged to not only engage in self-reflection but to act! SHEroes of the Bible challenges kids to personally engage with their family, friends and community by putting their faith into action.

 

Example from the story of Esther:

 

~ Beautiful Illustrations ~

Each story has a beautifully illustrated full-page image depicting each SHEro. Children will love the bright and colorful imagery that is sure to ignite their imaginations and awaken a hope that they too can change the world.

 

From the Story of Lydia

 

From the Story of Esther

 

SHEroes Included in This Book

SHEroes of the Bible contains 20 dynamic and empowering illustrated stories of 26 SHEroes from the Old and New Testament:

 

 

Purchase and Donate!

Choose from 6 incredible nonprofits:

 

International Justice Mission works to end modern day slavery, which includes sex trafficking. They partner with local police and justice systems around the world to end violence and injustice against people living in poverty.  Books donated will go to Ghana, Uganda, and Kenya. 

https://www.ijm.org/ ​

SERVE THE CHILDREN

 

Serve the Children offers hope and a future through God’s love to underserved children and families around the world by meeting their educational, physical, and emotional needs. Books donated will go to Zambia, India, and Liberia. 

https://www.servethechildren.com/

​

Olive Crest transforms the lives of at-risk children through the healing power of family. Their areas of outreach include: adoption, foster care, child abuse prevention, education support, teaching independent life skills training and mentoring, mental health treatment and family crisis intervention. Books donated will go to foster and adoptive families.

https://www.olivecrest.org/

 

​Seattle Children’s Hospital has consistently been ranked by U.S. News & World Report among the nation's best pediatric hospitals for the last 25 years. Books donated will go to families of hospitalized children. 

https://www.seattlechildrens.org/

 

 

Tacoma Rescue Mission serves the homeless and hurting in Pierce County, Washington, by providing shelter, daily meals, job readiness, education, addiction recovery, faith resources, along with mental health, veteran, and youth services. Books donated will go to underprivileged families at Tyler Family Housing and Adams Street Family Shelter.  

https://www.trm.org/

Converge Churches is a global organization that starts and strengthens churches worldwide. They are committed to starting missionally minded churches until every people, group, and community has heard the gospel. Donated books will go to Converge churches. 

https://www.converge.org/ 

 

Sample Story:

Shiphrah and Puah

 

SHEroes of Exodus, Chapter 1

“…But because the midwives feared God, they refused to obey the King’s orders…”

                                                                                                      Exodus 1:17 (NLT)

 

“It’s a boy!” shouted Shiphrah to her friend, Puah, and to the baby’s mother. A precious new baby had just been born into the world! Shiphrah and Puah loved their jobs as midwives—helping babies be born safely and then taking care of the new mothers.

The baby’s parents smiled at each other with happiness, but they exchanged worried looks, too. They were both excited and afraid at the same time.

The new parents, and the midwives, Shiphrah and Puah, were Hebrews. They lived in Egypt, the land of the pyramids. Although Egypt was not their home, the king of Egypt—called “Pharaoh,” liked the Hebrews so much that he gave them his best land to build their villages.

While they were living in Egypt, God blessed the Hebrews with so many children that it was hard to count them all. Each family had babies and then those babies grew up and had more babies. Before you knew it, the Hebrews were more numerous than the Egyptians!

During this time, the Pharaoh who had loved the Hebrew people died, and a new Pharaoh came into power. This new ruler became afraid that the Hebrews were growing too quickly in strength and numbers, and he thought to himself, “What if they take over Egypt? I have to make sure that doesn’t happen!”

So, Pharaoh made the Hebrews his slaves, in order that they wouldn’t get too powerful for the Egyptians. He made the Hebrews work hard day and night in the hot desert sun without being paid. They were forced to build the Egyptians’ homes and kingdom. They had to make bricks out of the clay that covered the ground, and their taskmasters beat them if they didn’t make enough. To make things worse, the Egyptians forced the Hebrew slaves to deliver the bricks on heavy carts that they had to push by hand. Doesn’t that sound terrible?

Even though life was very hard for the Israelites, God continued to bless them with more and more children. The more they suffered, the more babies they had!

When it was time for the Hebrew mothers to give birth to their babies, they would call for special nurses called “midwives, “who would come to their homes and help them. Shiphrah and Puah were the two lead nurses who oversaw all the other nurses in Egypt. They had a big job; they made sure that all the babies born were delivered healthy.

The Pharaoh continued to be fearful of how many Hebrew boys were being born. He wasn’t worried about the girls, just the boys, because he thought the boys would grow up and form an army to fight against him. So he made a plan to get rid of all the Hebrew boy babies as soon as they were born. He called Shiphrah and Puah to his palace and commanded them, “Every time you help a Hebrew woman have a baby, if it’s a boy, kill him, but if it’s a girl, let her live. That way we can stop the Hebrews from taking over Egypt.”

Shiphrah and Puah feared if they didn’t do what the Pharaoh told them, he might kill them. But they loved God more than they feared the Pharaoh. Shiphrah and Puah knew that something must be done to stop this horrible order from taking place, and they knew that as the lead midwives, they were the only ones who could do anything about it. Shiphrah and Puah were about to follow God’s plan and become SHEroes!

Shiphrah and Puah were in charge of many other midwives, so they gathered all who they knew loved God and told them the Pharaoh’s terrible plan. All the women bravely agreed to save the Hebrew boy babies from being killed. They knew that every time they saved a baby boy, they were risking their own lives, but they couldn’t stand by while innocent children were hurt!

This was their plan: each time a Hebrew woman gave birth to a baby, the nurses made sure to do all they could to help her deliver a healthy child—boy or girl. The mothers of the babies then risked punishment or even death by bravely hiding the baby boys from the Egyptians.

After a while, the Pharaoh ordered Shiphrah and Puah to come and see him at his palace. “Why are there still Hebrew boys being born?” he thundered.

They stood frozen in fear. Cleverly, they told him, “The Hebrew women are so strong that the babies are already born before we get there!” And the Pharaoh believed them.

Shiphrah and Puah, and many midwives and mothers, made the choice to trust God in spite of their fear of the Pharaoh. They saved countless lives, including a boy named Moses. God had an amazing plan to one day use Moses to rescue His people, the Hebrews, from slavery in Egypt and bring them to a beautiful new land – a land where they were free. Moses would lead the way for the greatest rescuer the world has ever known—Jesus!

Devotion:

  1. Shiphrah and Puah feared Pharaoh and his army, but they trusted God despite their fears. What are some things you are afraid of? ​
  2. Take a moment to talk to God about your fears and ask Him to give you courage to trust that God is bigger than anything you are afraid of.
  3. God often gives us friends or family to help us face our fears. Shiphrah and Puah faced their fears together. Who is someone you can face your fears with?

 

What is a SHEro?

Here are a few things that mark a SHEro:

 

Why a Campaign?

1. Production is expensive!

Writing a book is an expensive undertaking! It cost about $15,000 for editing, illustrations, printing, and production costs. Creating a quality product adds up quickly! But rest assured that every dollar raised will go toward the publishing and printing of this incredible book. Our pre-order campaign will help us with all the costs while giving YOU the opportunity to get this book 6-8 months before it hits bookstores! We also have other fun perks for you to take advantage of while supplies last. 

2. Make a Global Impact!

Your support will help get this book into households around the world, inspiring this next generation to become the brave, fearless, faith-filled leaders God created them to be! Through our "buy one, give one" perks, you can gift SHEroes of the Bible to nonprofits all over the world. You are not just purchasing a book, you are shaping a future generation!

 

Great for Churches, Nonprofits, and Home School Co-ops!

If you are on staff or a supporter of a church organization, a nonprofit, or a school co-op, make sure to take advantage of this fantastic perk! You have the opportunity to purchase books AND the PDFs of all the SHEroes coloring pages! Each coloring page is identical to the illustrations inside this incredible children's book! 

 

 

 

 

Fun facts about our first edition, SHEroes of the Bible: Women of the Old Testament

First Edition

 

We sent books all over the world!

 

Pictures from China, Tanzania, and Liberia!

We were honored to partner with nonprofits throughout the globe! It is our mission to make sure every child has the opportunity to hear about these courageous SHEroes of the Bible! Many children around the world face challenging situations that are difficult for some of us to understand. But our hope is that no matter what a child has gone through, they can know that there is a God who sees them, loves them and wants to do great things through them. God can use any child to change the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who are unable to support financially, we would love it if you could share this link with everyone you know and/or send personal texts or messages sharing this link. We want to get this Indiegogo campaign in front of as many people as possible and cannot do it without you. Simply copy and paste the link to text friends, or click the Facebook, Instagram or Twitter links to share on your personal accounts.

Serve the Children offers hope and a future through God’s love to underserved children and families around the world by meeting their educational, physical, and emotional needs. Books donated will go to Zambia, India, and Liberia. 
https://www.servethechildren.com/
​
Olive Crest transforms the lives of at-risk children through the healing power of family. Their areas of outreach include: adoption, foster care, child abuse prevention, education support, teaching independent life skills training and mentoring, mental health treatment and family crisis intervention. Books donated will go to foster and adoptive families.
https://www.olivecrest.org/

 
​Seattle Children’s Hospital has consistently been ranked by U.S. News & World Report among the nation's best pediatric hospitals for the last 25 years. Books donated will go to families of hospitalized children. 
https://www.seattlechildrens.org/
 

 
Tacoma Rescue Mission serves the homeless and hurting in Pierce County, Washington, by providing shelter, daily meals, job readiness, education, addiction recovery, faith resources, along with mental health, veteran, and youth services. Books donated will go to underprivileged families at Tyler Family Housing and Adams Street Family Shelter.  
https://www.trm.org/

Converge Churches is a global organization that starts and strengthens churches worldwide. They are committed to starting missionally minded churches until every people, group, and community has heard the gospel. Donated books will go to Converge churches. 
https://www.converge.org/ 
 
Sample Story:
Shiphrah and Puah

 
SHEroes of Exodus, Chapter 1
“…But because the midwives feared God, they refused to obey the King’s orders…” 
                                                                                                      Exodus 1:17 (NLT)
 
“It’s a boy!” shouted Shiphrah to her friend, Puah, and to the baby’s mother. A precious new baby had just been born into the world! Shiphrah and Puah loved their jobs as midwives—helping babies be born safely and then taking care of the new mothers.
The baby’s parents smiled at each other with happiness, but they exchanged worried looks, too. They were both excited and afraid at the same time.
The new parents, and the midwives, Shiphrah and Puah, were Hebrews. They lived in Egypt, the land of the pyramids. Although Egypt was not their home, the king of Egypt—called “Pharaoh,” liked the Hebrews so much that he gave them his best land to build their villages.
While they were living in Egypt, God blessed the Hebrews with so many children that it was hard to count them all. Each family had babies and then those babies grew up and had more babies. Before you knew it, the Hebrews were more numerous than the Egyptians!
During this time, the Pharaoh who had loved the Hebrew people died, and a new Pharaoh came into power. This new ruler became afraid that the Hebrews were growing too quickly in strength and numbers, and he thought to himself, “What if they take over Egypt? I have to make sure that doesn’t happen!”
So, Pharaoh made the Hebrews his slaves, in order that they wouldn’t get too powerful for the Egyptians. He made the Hebrews work hard day and night in the hot desert sun without being paid. They were forced to build the Egyptians’ homes and kingdom. They had to make bricks out of the clay that covered the ground, and their taskmasters beat them if they didn’t make enough. To make things worse, the Egyptians forced the Hebrew slaves to deliver the bricks on heavy carts that they had to push by hand. Doesn’t that sound terrible?
Even though life was very hard for the Israelites, God continued to bless them with more and more children. The more they suffered, the more babies they had!
When it was time for the Hebrew mothers to give birth to their babies, they would call for special nurses called “midwives, “who would come to their homes and help them. Shiphrah and Puah were the two lead nurses who oversaw all the other nurses in Egypt. They had a big job; they made sure that all the babies born were delivered healthy.
The Pharaoh continued to be fearful of how many Hebrew boys were being born. He wasn’t worried about the girls, just the boys, because he thought the boys would grow up and form an army to fight against him. So he made a plan to get rid of all the Hebrew boy babies as soon as they were born. He called Shiphrah and Puah to his palace and commanded them, “Every time you help a Hebrew woman have a baby, if it’s a boy, kill him, but if it’s a girl, let her live. That way we can stop the Hebrews from taking over Egypt.”
Shiphrah and Puah feared if they didn’t do what the Pharaoh told them, he might kill them. But they loved God more than they feared the Pharaoh. Shiphrah and Puah knew that something must be done to stop this horrible order from taking place, and they knew that as the lead midwives, they were the only ones who could do anything about it. Shiphrah and Puah were about to follow God’s plan and become SHEroes!
Shiphrah and Puah were in charge of many other midwives, so they gathered all who they knew loved God and told them the Pharaoh’s terrible plan. All the women bravely agreed to save the Hebrew boy babies from being killed. They knew that every time they saved a baby boy, they were risking their own lives, but they couldn’t stand by while innocent children were hurt!
This was their plan: each time a Hebrew woman gave birth to a baby, the nurses made sure to do all they could to help her deliver a healthy child—boy or girl. The mothers of the babies then risked punishment or even death by bravely hiding the baby boys from the Egyptians.
After a while, the Pharaoh ordered Shiphrah and Puah to come and see him at his palace. “Why are there still Hebrew boys being born?” he thundered.
They stood frozen in fear. Cleverly, they told him, “The Hebrew women are so strong that the babies are already born before we get there!” And the Pharaoh believed them.
Shiphrah and Puah, and many midwives and mothers, made the choice to trust God in spite of their fear of the Pharaoh. They saved countless lives, including a boy named Moses. God had an amazing plan to one day use Moses to rescue His people, the Hebrews, from slavery in Egypt and bring them to a beautiful new land – a land where they were free. Moses would lead the way for the greatest rescuer the world has ever known—Jesus!
Devotion:


Shiphrah and Puah feared Pharaoh and his army, but they trusted God despite their fears. What are some things you are afraid of? ​

Take a moment to talk to God about your fears and ask Him to give you courage to trust that God is bigger than anything you are afraid of. 
God often gives us friends or family to help us face our fears. Shiphrah and Puah faced their fears together. Who is someone you can face your fears with? 

 
What is a SHEro?
Here are a few things that mark a SHEro:

 
Why a Campaign?
1. Production is expensive!
Writing a book is an expensive undertaking! It cost about $15,000 for editing, illustrations, printing, and production costs. Creating a quality product adds up quickly! But rest assured that every dollar raised will go toward the publishing and printing of this incredible book. Our pre-order campaign will help us with all the costs while giving YOU the opportunity to get this book 6-8 months before it hits bookstores! We also have other fun perks for you to take advantage of while supplies last. 
2. Make a Global Impact!
Your support will help get this book into households around the world, inspiring this next generation to become the brave, fearless, faith-filled leaders God created them to be! Through our "buy one, give one" perks, you can gift SHEroes of the Bible to nonprofits all over the world. You are not just purchasing a book, you are shaping a future generation!
 
Great for Churches, Nonprofits, and Home School Co-ops!
If you are on staff or a supporter of a church organization, a nonprofit, or a school co-op, make sure to take advantage of this fantastic perk! You have the opportunity to purchase books AND the PDFs of all the SHEroes coloring pages! Each coloring page is identical to the illustrations inside this incredible children's book! 
 

 

 

 
Fun facts about our first edition, SHEroes of the Bible: Women of the Old Testament

First Edition
 
We sent books all over the world!

 
Pictures from China, Tanzania, and Liberia!


We were honored to partner with nonprofits throughout the globe! It is our mission to make sure every child has the opportunity to hear about these courageous SHEroes of the Bible! Many children around the world face challenging situations that are difficult for some of us to understand. But our hope is that no matter what a child has gone through, they can know that there is a God who sees them, loves them and wants to do great things through them. God can use any child to change the world!
Other Ways You Can Help
For those of you who are unable to support financially, we would love it if you could share this link with everyone you know and/or send personal texts or messages sharing this link. We want to get this Indiegogo campaign in front of as many people as possible and cannot do it without you. Simply copy and paste the link to text friends, or click the Facebook, Instagram or Twitter links to share on your personal accounts.

story:
I. Author Bio. Mansur Johnson was born in Illinois and lived on both coasts. He has a BA from Miami University in Oxford, Ohio, an MA from the University of Illinois, and 60 hours toward his PhD at the University of Iowa, with studies at the University of California at Berkeley and the Universidad de Mexico in Mexico City.
 

After teaching English for one year at Northern Michigan University in Marquette, Michigan, Mansur retired from teaching and went to California to join the hippies. He became one of the first students of Samuel L. Lewis, a Sufi teacher and Zen Master, as well as his personal secretary. Mr. Lewis became the subject of Mansur’s book Murshid: A personal memoir of life with American Sufi Samuel L. Lewis, Peaceworks Publications, Seattle, WA 2006.

One of Mr. Lewis’s colleagues was Shamcher Bryn Beorse, who was the subject of Mansur’s book Shamcher: A memoir of Bryn Beorse’s struggle to introduce Ocean Energy to the United States. This book is offered free on line for activists to expedite the introduction of solar ocean energy, or OTEC, ocean thermal energy conversion. www.shamcher.org/6.html

Mr. Lewis’s teacher, Hazrat Inayat Khan, published 12 volumes of Sufi teachings in the 1960s, which Mansur combed for Sufi stories. He compiled and edited over 400 Sufi tales, published as Big Tales: All the stories in the 12 volumes of The Sufi Message of Hazrat Inayat Khan, The Einstein Academy, Tucson, AZ 2015.

After Mr. Lewis' death in 1971, Mansur started a Sufi Center in Boston, MA, and supported himself by installing auto glass, as well as traveling and teaching Sufism at weekend workshops and seminars. In 1980, Mansur moved to Tucson and found work in the film industry when Hollywood came to Arizona by working in 44 feature films and TV movies as a Grip. He found employment on such big Hollywood local films as Tombstone, Maverick, and The Quick and the Dead.

A member of IATSE, the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees, Mansur transitioned from film to work as a stage carpenter at the University of Arizona’s Centennial Hall for Broadway in Tucson, as well as a Trade Show professional, setting up such events as the Gem & Mineral Show in Tucson.

In 2017 The Einstein Academy published Don’t Search, Celebrate! The Collected poems of Mansur Johnson. Since then, Mansur began work on In the Footsteps of Alexander the Great, The 1998 Footsteps of Alexander the Great Tour, Part 1.

II. I am seeking $1,850 to be used 1) $350 to convert 524 slides to jpegs  2) $700 for 2 professional covers ($350 x 2) 3) $800 for editorial services ($400 x 2) = $1,850

III. The importance of this project is twofold: 1) as a way to announce the new book and 2) to obtain pre-publication sales, as detailed in The Perk below.

IV. The Perk for contributing $50 is to receive one book (a $30 value).

V.  Overview of In the Footsteps of Alexander the Great

                                                                 INTRODUCTION TO PART 1

            I am grateful to Michael Wood for coming out with a book and TV special called In the Footsteps of Alexander the Great while I was preparing for our trip In the Footsteps of Alexander the Great.

            I followed Mr. Wood’s maps, noted his omissions, and expanded his narrow focus. I renamed our trip The 1998 Footsteps of Alexander the Great Tour.

            Why read this book when Michael Wood wrote the book and made the TV show already?

            First, let me say, Michael Wood followed the steps of Alexander to most of the places we visit. Unlike us, he gives the reader Alexander’s great career, his battles and victories, and anecdotes and contradictions from sources, meaning the ancient writers, Arrian, Quintus Curtius, Diodorus of Sicily, and Plutarch, plus Strabo and Pliny, Greek geographers, geographer being another way to characterize one who wrote a descriptive history of people and places from different regions of the world known to his era.

            We followed—I say “we” because my companion was my girl friend from Switzerland, Marianne—the steps of Alexander and learned, like Alexander, what these parts of the world are like, what the land feels like. Like Alexander, we lingered at beautiful places.

            For example, Wood never mentions Phaeselis on the south coast of Turkey. Alexander spent the winter of 334 B.C. in this beautiful place, thus concluding his first year of conquest. We got off track for three days in equally beautiful, neighboring Olympos (Chapter 9), which unlike Phaeselis, was one of Lycia’s six major cities with a vote of 3 each in the Lycian league.

            We sought to learn, like Alexander, the history. History after Alexander, like Roman monuments, was of incidental interest to us. Sometimes the Romans’ utilization of an earlier Alexander site, such as Ephesus (Chapter 5), required that we look at stuff less than 2,000 years old.

           Of particular interest to me was Alexander’s interest in dreams, visions, and prophecy. The Didyma Temple (Chapter 6) and Siwa Oasis (Chapter 21) are two oracle centers Alexander visited. This implies oracles, temples, pagan religion, gods and goddesses, divine guidance, divinity, the deep questions: How did it all begin? Where did we come from?

            Going into this trip, I was working from an interpretation of ancient history gained from Zecharia Sitchin that I sought to investigate.

            Sitchin’s timetable for humanity is: 450,000 B.C., there was the first contact with the 12th planet, a planet in our solar system with a 3,600 year interval. It becomes the 12th, if you add Pluto, Moon, and Earth to the other eight.  

            I think that construction of the platform at Baalbek was interrupted by the Deluge, as reported in Baalbek (Chapter 17). Researcher Graham Hancock agrees with me. After the Deluge circa 11,000 B.C. destroyed life forms, humanity was re-seeded by the 12 planet making another pass and producing agriculture (circa  11,000 B.C.), then the Neolithic culture (circa 7,500 B.C.) and, finally, the Sumerian civilization (circa 3,800 B.C.).

            Notice the 3,600 year intervals. The gods were present among mankind, according to Sitchin’s evidence on Mesopotamian cylinder seals and Hittite rock carvings. In Chapter 13, there is a rock carving with the king meeting with four gods, wearing their distinctive garb. Were the gods present among mankind? How are we to understand these carvings?

            My only problem with Sitchen is: Why wasn’t the circa 200 B.C. fly by noted by ancient writers? They wrote about Alexander who lived circa 300 B.C. Given the 3,600 year interval, why were there no contemporary notations of the 12 planet’s arrival? A few pages above, I cited many of the ancient historians and geographers who provided written records of the times. They wrote about Alexander, not always contemporaneously, who lived 100 years before the alleged flyby.

            By the time of Alexander, whatever the details of religious practice, there were, no doubt, various priesthoods that looked back to the so called “first time” (zep tepi in Egyptian).

            Babylonian priests, for example, told Alexander when he reached Iraq in 331 B.C.) that their records went back 25,000 years.

            Egyptian priests wrote in the Hermetica that “Egypt is an image of heaven …”, and Robert Bauval (The Orion Mystery) showed how the three pyramids at Giza are laid out to match the belt of Orion in the sky.

            I believe the Egyptian pyramids and Sphinx were built around 10,500 B.C., just after the Deluge, as reported in the Giza chapter (Chapter 22).

            My thoughts and beliefs are based on my own first hand observations, as well as those of others I cite as sources.

story:
The Black Spot & Little Girl Blue

Originally from South Africa and currently residing in Spain, I am a writer and researcher passionate about how our upbringing, environment and life experiences mould us into who we are today. This is mostly due to my education in Psychology, Criminology and my own personal encounters growing up in South Africa and Portugal.

This campaign is pertinent in conveying the darker themes of childhood, such as fitting in, loneliness and being different. Helping to achieve my funding goal would help in sharing this with others, through employing the necessary professionals in copy editing, typesetting, marketing, publishing and the distribution of a story which I think is very relateable, not only to children but adults too. The message I hope that readers walk away with is that each of us is wholly unique and different and that is something magical and should be celebrated.

Remember growing up? Need I say more?

What I Need & What You'll Get

I need a funding of 1500 EUROS for:

  • Copy Editing
  • Typesetting
  • Marketing
  • Publication
  • Distribution

There are unique perks for funders! Options include:

  • Hardcover copies
  • Paperback Copies
  • Prints of Illustrations
  • E-book Version

Risks & Challenges

The risks I face are not reaching my funding goal, for which I have set at the minimum in order to achieve the aforementioned tasks but, hey, that's life! 

If you reach for a star, you might not get one,  but you wont come up with a handful of mud either!

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but you can certainly help spread the word by sharing this campaign!
